name: A'Rath Forest
description: The A'rath Forest was located just east of the city of Ehrlitan on the shores of the Otataral Sea.  The waters offshore were known for sharks so large that even Dhenrabi left them alone.

name: Aallov
description: Aallov was a city on the coast of the Dojal Hading Sea on Seven Cities. It was located on the road that traveled between Asmar and Teppes.

name: Aamil
description: Aamil was a port city in Skolati. It had the look of a fortress stronghold built specifically to resist any assault from the sea. Twin curving moles met at a narrow harbour entrance flanked by stout guard towers. The main fortress rose straight from the water in a tall featureless curtain wall of salt-stained grey limestone blocks. Access from the harbour was limited to the narrow inlet between the fortified towers.

name: Abor
description: Abor was a city in central Jourilan and the site of the Jourilan Imperial Games.

name: Abor (Jourilan)
description: Abor was a city in central Jourilan and the site of the Jourilan Imperial Games.

name: Ahnkahr
description: The city of Ahnkahr was located on the southern extremity of the Geleen Plain, in the Kahr Hills. Directly north was the ancient tel of Kahr from which both the city and the hills derived their names.

name: Ahol Tapur
description: Ahol Tapur was a city in the northeast of the Seven Cities continent on the coast of the Otataral Sea. It lay near the Path'apur Mountains and was connected to Hissar in the south via the Tapur Road.

name: Aireck
description: Aireck was a city in western Quon Tali.  It was south of Bylt and north of Garal.  To its east was Bastial.

name: Ak'Ryn
description: Ak'ryn was the lands of the Akrynnai people. It was located in eastern Lether, between the D'rhasilhani and the Awl.

name: Ak'ryn Corridor
description: The Ak'Ryn Corridor was a landmass located between the Saphinand Kingdom and the Bolkando in the southeast of the continent of Lether.

name: Almas
description: Almas was a modest Letherii town in northwestern Lether distinguished only by its garrison and stables.  It was located south of Brous and Cargo and southwest of Brans Keep. A feeder track in its vicinity led southwards to the Lether River.

name: Anari Narrows
description: The Anari Narrows was where the River Thin emptied into the Sea of Hate in eastern Bael. South of Kurzan, the waters were calm and sheltered, and used to anchor ocean-going merchant ships.

name: Anditi Pura
description: Anditi Pura was the Thaumaturg capital city, in the north of the Kingdom of the Thaumaturgs. The city had no walls or defences of any kind, being deep within Thaumaturg territories, in a land with no other organised nations to threaten them. The centre of the city contained an extensive facility called the "Inner City" where the ruling Thaumaturg class worked and lived.

name: Anguish Coast
description: The Anguish Coast was the western shore of the inland Dread Sea on Assail.

name: Anklos
description: Anklos was a city in northeastern Genabackis just south of the Harbinger Peninsula.  It lay on the coast where the River Letor emptied into the Rust Ocean.

name: Antr
description: Antr was the southernmost city in the Empire of Jourilan along the western coast.

name: Apple
description: Apple was a Genabackan Free City located on the Free City Plain situated along the coast north east of Tulips.

name: Arath
description: Arath was a city located at the foot of a small mountain range near the western coast of Quon Tali.  To its north was Panys.

name: Aren
description: Aren [air-en or ar-en] was a port-city on the southern coast of the Seven Cities continent and one of its seven Holy Cities. After the continent's conquest by the Malazan Empire, the city was the headquarters of the Imperial High Command.

name: Ashok
description: Ashok was a city on the long Maadil Peninsula dividing the Kokakal Sea and the Maadil Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent. To the city's north lay Taxila and to the south lay Lothal.

name: Aska
description: Aska was a city on the western coast of the Nap Sea in southern Quon Tali which lay south of Cawn. To the southwest of Aska was the city of Feng and further due south on the coast was Borid.

name: Asmar
description: The city of Asmar was on the northern shore of the Dojal Hading Sea, at the mouth of the river P'atha, just east of the Holy City of Ubaryd in Seven Cities.

name: Asmur
description: The city of Asmar was on the northern shore of the Dojal Hading Sea, at the mouth of the river P'atha, just east of the Holy City of Ubaryd in Seven Cities.

name: Assail
description: The continent of Assail was situated between Genabackis and the Letherii continent. It was held to be the most dangerous and hostile part of the Malazan world. The Crimson Guard mercenaries and some T'lan Imass were known to have engagements there. The Malazans knew of the existence of Assail and the Wreckers' Coast along its shores, but the Empire had chosen to make no incursions there due to the extreme danger of the land. It was known that the continent was dominated by a human leader (or possibly several human leaders) whose armies were powerful enough to destroy T'lan Imass forces, the Ifayle and the Kerluhm. Little else was known of it.

name: Assail (novel)
description: Assail is the sixth novel by Canadian author Ian Cameron Esslemont. It is set in the world of the Malazan Book of the Fallen, a ten-volume epic fantasy series by Esslemont's friend and colleague Steven Erikson. Esslemont and Erikson co-created the Malazan world in the 1980s.

name: Athrans
description: Athrans was a city in central Quon Tali.  It was located on a river that crossed the continent from Forest Fenn to the Bloor Sea at Unta, the capital of the Malazan Empire. To its east was Jurda, to its northwest was Voron, and to its west was Thades.

name: Attic
description: Attic was a city on the western coast of Quon Tali.  It shared the same bay as the city of Quon Tali to its northeast.  Along the coast to its northwest was Ebond.  To its west was Panys.

name: Awl
description: The Awl were a nomadic people native to the continent of Lether. Their homeland was known as the Awl'dan, which was located on the eastern border of the Kingdom of Lether.  The Letherii encroached on their territory in an effort to conquer them. As a result, the Awl were a people in decline. The populations of their camps and domestic herds grew smaller and their grazing lands were shrinking. Those clans remaining clashed over resources.

name: Awl'Dan
description: The Awl'dan was the territory occupied by the Awl people. It was located to the east of the Empire of Lether and south of the Bluerose Sea. It was described as an open, sweeping plain, whose leveled earth lay beneath a vast sky. The Awl'dan was also home to grass covered valleys, small stands of forest, and ancient dry riverbeds. In the spring, tiny flowers erupted from every hillside and berries ripened in the valleys.

name: Ayjhan
description: Ayjhan was an island city in northwestern Genabackis.  On the opposite side of the island was the key Malazan trading city of Nathilog.

name: Aythan
description: Aythan was a city on the southern coast of Quon Tali facing the Bloor Sea. To its southwest was Carasin and to its northeast was Nure.

name: Back
description: Back was a city in Estobanse Province, Kolanse.  The Ses Mountains were to the north.

name: Bad Luck Isle
description: Bad Luck Isle was among the fluke islands at the tip of southern Genabackis' tail.  It was located between King Call's Isle and the Night Ship Islands.

name: Bael
description: Bael was a sub-continent (or possibly a region within Assail) situated south of Assail and southeast of Korelri. It was bordered on its eastern shores by the Domain Ocean. The tribes of Bael worshipped a god known as Father Wind.

name: Bakra
description: Bakra was a town east of the Karas Sea on Seven Cities.  It was located on the road between Caron Tepasi and the Gilar Oasis.

name: Bakun
description: Bakun was a city at the mouth of the River Bakun on the Dojal Hading Sea on Seven Cities.  It was north of Jamdat and south of the Caron Mountains.  At one time it was the residence of Prince I'farah.  The Bakun Road linked the city to Teppes and Asmar to the northwest.

name: Bakutalar Forest
description: The Bakutalar Forest was located in the Caron Mountains on the eastern part of the Seven Cities continent. Multiple rivers from the area of the forest combined to form the River Bakun, which ran south to the Dojal Hading Sea.  Another unnamed river left the forest to run southeast to Venj.

name: Balahn
description: Balahn was a village in Seven Cities known mainly as the gateway to the Aren Way.  It was a "squalid collection of low mudbrick houses, home to perhaps forty residents."  The only structure less than a hundred years old was the arched gate built by Dassem Ultor's engineers marking the start of the ten mile (three league) military road to Aren.

name: Bali
description: Bali was a city in Katakan north of the Barrier Range on Korel Island.

name: Balstro
description: Balstro was a city in northeastern Quon Tali. It was located on the River Nye, which passed from the edge of the Wickan Plains to the Bloor Sea near Gris. To its north was Habal and to its south was Nita.

name: Bandiko Desert
description: The Bandiko Desert covered the northwestern part of Otataral Island. It was separated from the rest of the island by a narrow isthmus and the Talgai Sea.

name: Bandiko Sea
description: Bandiko Sea lay to the northeast of Seven Cities. To its southwest lay Bandiko Desert and Talgai Sea, while the Sea of Gallada was directly south.

name: Banith
description: Banith was a seaside city in the Kingdom of Rool, on the Island of Fist. Its front street ran roughly eastâ€“west along the docks. When Ipshank first arrived there, he noted that "the town climbed shallow coastal hills, its roofs dominated by the tall jutting spires of the Holy Cloister and the many gables of the Hospice nearby. Beyond these, rich cultivated rolling plains, land once forested, stretched into the mist-shrouded distance."

name: Baran
description: Baran was a Hound of Shadow described as lean and scarred, with shoulders level to a man's chest. Baran had mottled brown and tan fur. His mate was Blind, and he was the sire of Gear.

name: Barghast Range
description: The Barghast Range lay to the east of the Bhederin Plateau on Genabackis. It was north of the Vision Plain and Capustan. Its white peaks were jagged and forbidding.

name: Barren Coast
description: The Barren Coast was located in northwestern Assail along the shore of Reacher's Ocean. The name was synonymous to outsiders with the Plain of Ghosts.

name: Barrier Range
description: The Barrier Range marked the border between Korelri and Katakan on the Korel Island.

name: Barrow of the Redeemer
description: The Barrow of the Redeemer, also known as the Great Barrow and Itkovian's Gift, was located just outside the city of Coral.

name: Bastial
description: Bastial was a city on the Seti Plains of Quon Tali.  It was west of En Krael and southwest of Nadir.  The Idryn river passed eastward by the city downriver to Li Heng.

name: Bastion
description: Bastion was a small city on the frontier of the Pannion Domin. It was located on a lake in central Genabackis southwest of Coral near the Godswalk Mountains. Squat walls surrounded the city's characteristic block-like, tiered buildings. Strangers were not welcome.

name: Bathi
description: Bathi was a city in Itko Kan on the coast of the Horn Ocean.  It lay west of Wal Fend and east of Horan.

name: Bay of No Harbour
description: The Bay of No Harbour was located in the crook of Genabackis' west coast and its southern tail.  The bay fed into the Rust Ocean.  To the bay's southeast was the city Cyral.  To its southwest was North March.

name: Bay of Timber
description: The Bay of Timber was found on the northeast coast of Assail extending westward from the Sea of Hate. It was ringed by the Plain of Chance to the north, the Bone Range to the west, and Wreckers' Coast to the south. The deadly Fear Narrows led from the bay's southern end to the inland Dread Sea.

name: Bear
description: Bear was a city in north central Genabackis. It lay on the northern shore of a lake across from Patch.  To the east was Cat.

name: Belade
description: Belade was a city in Falar located north of the Great Fenn Range and south of the city of Cabil on the shores of the Strom Sea.

name: Belbasi
description: Belbasi was one of several island cities in the Maadil Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent. Other nearby cities included Canhasan, Kaliban, and Karokitch.

name: Belid
description: Belid was a city in Falar located on one of the smaller Falari Isles due west of Strike Island.

name: Beller
description: Beller was one of the cities in Truce on the continent of Lether. It was located on the shore of the Dracons Sea.

name: Benich Hill
description: Benich Hill was located in the Nenoth Odhan on Seven Cities. It lay between the Tholemon and Sanimon tels.

name: Bettrys
description: Bettrys was a city in northwestern Genabackis located on North Horsehead Lake, just east of the Grinning Face Hills, at the western end of the Owndos Range.

name: Bhederin Plateau
description: Bhederin Plateau was a plateau located on central Genabackis. It was named after the native herbivores, the bhederin.

name: Bhulrch
description: Bhulrch was a town at the northeastern end of the Clatar Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent.

name: Black City
description: Black City was a port city on the Black Water Strait in the kingdom of Mare on the Island of Fist.

name: Black Coral
description: The Terondai was a room in the New Palace of Coral where Anomander Rake had commissioned the symbol of Mother Dark to be inset to both the floor and roof. It was a large domed room, as was the original in Kharkanas, which was the "heart" of Kurald Galain's manifestation in the mortal realm and could be considered the Temple of Darkness, however it held no power until the Gate of Darkness was freed from its prison in Dragnipur.

name: Black Fingers Forest
description: Black Fingers Forest occupied a peninsula on the northeastern coast of the Black Sea on Assail where that body of water emptied into the Sea of Hate. It was bounded to the north by the Green River and the mountains known as Grey Stone.

name: Black River
description: The Black River ran from the Black Stone Mountains to the southwestern coast of the Black Sea on Assail.

name: Black Sea
description: The Black Sea was a long and narrow body of water running east-west that partially separated Bael in the south from the rest of the Assail continent. At its eastern end, the Black Sea joined the Sea of Hate.

name: Black Stone Mountains
description: The Black Stone Mountains ran east-west across southern Assail from Reacher's Ocean to the Black Sea. The Black River likely originated there.

name: Black Water Strait
description: The Black Water Strait connected Bloodmare Ocean with the inland Sender's Sea, separating Fist Island from Stygg and southern Korel.

name: Blackdog Forest
description: Blackdog Forest, or Swamp, was a large boreal forest surrounded by swamp located on the shield bedrock of the continent of Genabackis. It was the site of major battles between the Malaz 5th Army and the allied armies of Caladan Brood and the Crimson Guard during the First Campaigns.

name: Bleeder's Cut
description: Bleeder's Cut was a narrow channel which separated Dourkan from Remnant Isle in the Lands of Fist. It connected the Crack Strait and Flow Strait.

name: Blight
description: Blight was the easternmost city in the Empire of Jourilan, on the western shore of the Blight Sea. The city on the Bay of Blight was surrounded by a stone wall.

name: Blight Sea
description: The Blight Sea separated the Empire of Jourilan from Jasston and the Plains of Blight.

name: Blood
description: Blood was a town in southern Malaz Island.  It was located on a river originating from the Blood Spring and was not far from the Strait of Storms coast.  A road followed the coast to the west to Jakata.  Also to the west was the South Rust Hills.  The Taral Plain was to the east.

name: Blood and Bone
description: Blood and Bone is the fifth novel by Canadian author Ian Cameron Esslemont. It is set in the world of the Malazan Book of the Fallen, a ten-volume epic fantasy series by Esslemont's friend and colleague Steven Erikson. Esslemont and Erikson co-created the Malazan world in the 1980s.

name: Blood Isthmus
description: The Blood Isthmus was a narrow strip of land between the cities of Xixr and Poon in Katakan.

name: Blood Range
description: The Salt Mountains of northern Assail were also known as the Salt Peaks, the Salt Range, and the Blood Range.  They were divided into two regions known as the East and West Salt Ranges.  At the centre of the range were the Bare Rock Peaks surrounded by a great Ice Plain.  On their lower slopes were the Greathalls of the Iceblood clans.

name: Blood Spring
description: Blood Spring was located in a forest in south central Malaz Island directly below the North Rust Hills.  It was the source of a river that passed through the town of Blood before reaching the coast of the Strait of Storms.

name: Bloodmare Ocean
description: The Bloodmare Ocean was located east of the Lands of Fist.

name: Bloor
description: Bloor was an inland city on the River Bloor on the eastern half of the continent of Quon Tali. It lay about midway between Cawn and Unta. To its north was the city of Thade.

name: Bloor Sea
description: The Bloor Sea lay between the continent of Quon Tali and Kartool Island. It was bordered by the Falari Sea to the North and Reacher's Ocean to the South.

name: Blued
description: Blued was a city on the northern shore of the Owndos Sea in northern Genabackis.

name: Blueglow Point
description: Blueglow Point was the northernmost extent of the nation of Isthmus on the continent of Lether. It reached into the Hyacinth Passage which linked the Dracons Sea to the Hyacinth Reach.

name: Bluerose
description: Bluerose was a formerly independent kingdom that was subjugated and reduced to a protectorate by the Kingdom of Lether. It was located in the north central part of the continent of Lether, along the northwest coast of the Bluerose Sea. The kingdom's name came from a sapphire-colored mineral, intricate as roses, which grew in the caves that were prevalent in the region's Bluerose Mountains.

name: Bluerose Mountains
description: The Bluerose Mountains ran through the kingdom of Bluerose and encircled the inland Bluerose Sea on the Lether continent.  The mountains, sea, and kingdom all derived their name from the flowers of sapphire that grew in the deep caves buried beneath the mountains.

name: Bluerose Sea
description: The Bluerose Sea was situated in northeastern Lether. The Sea's name came from a sapphire-coloured mineral, intricate as roses, which 'grew' in the caves that were prevalent in the mountains which bordered the Sea.

name: Bluff Point
description: Bluff Point was one of four promontories of land located on the southern tail of Genabackis.  It extended into the Galatan Sweep near Exile.  To the northeast was Cape Castle.

name: Bodd
description: Bodd was a city in northern Genabackis. It lay north of Yend and south of the Owndos Sea (Lake Blued).

name: Bolkando
description: The Bolkando Kingdom was located in eastern Lether. Though nominally ruled by their King Tarkulf, the true power seemed to rest in the hands of Chancellor Rava and Queen Abrastal.

name: Bone Peninsula
description: The Bone Peninsula was located in the eastern portion of Assail. It projected southeastwards from the vicinity of the Sea of Gold dividing the Bay of Timber from the Dread Sea. Passage between those two bodies of water could only be accomplished through the deadly Fear Narrows. The Bone Range ran up the entire spine of the peninsula before continuing on into northern Assail.

name: Bone Range
description: The Bone Range crossed much of eastern Assail. Starting on the Bone Peninsula, it ran in a northerly direction before extending in a more easterly direction at the Sea of Gold. The range finally came to an end on the Plain of Longing near the coast of the Sea of Hate.

name: Bones
description: Bones was a town on the southern shore of the Bay of Timber in Assail near the Wreckers' Coast. It was part of the Bone Peninsula, and backed onto the Bone Range in the southwest. It was southeast of Rough Landing and north of Deep Well.

name: Borid
description: Borid was a city on the western coast of the Nap Sea in Itko Kan.  It lay south of Aska.  To the northwest was the city of Feng and further south on the coast was Buld.

name: Bounty
description: Bounty was a city on the coast of south Genabackis. It was a member of the Confederacy of Free Cities.  To its west was Exile and to its east was Golden.

name: Brans Keep
description: Brans Keep was a Letherii fortress about two days' journey by horse to the northwest of Letheras.  It was the final major fortification passed when approaching the capital city from the north or west.  The town of Dissent was a few leagues to the keep's southwest.

name: Break Island
description: Break Island was one of several in a chain of islands off Malaz Island's southwestern coast.  It lay across the Inside Passage from the city of Jakata.

name: Breed Bay
description: Breed Bay was located in Tiste Edur lands north of the Letherii Empire. To the northeast were Den-Ratha lands, to the southeast, Sollanta and to the southwest, Merude.

name: Bridle
description: Bridle was a city in the western region of the Letherii Empire.  It was located on the Brous River, which led to the Domain Ocean.  Upriver was the city of Miner Sluice and the town of Brous.

name: Bris
description: Bris was a city near the eastern coast of the Nap Sea in southern Quon Tali.  It lay upriver and to the north of Marl. To the northwest was the city of Halas. The Napan Isles lay due south of Bris.

name: Broland Hills
description: The Broland Hills were located in central Malaz Island and formed the southern border of the Ricker Mountains. The Broland and Pyre Rivers passed on either side of the hills.  Directly to the south was the town of Losten.

name: Broland Meet
description:
Broland Meet was a town in southwestern Malaz Island located at the confluence of the River Broland and the West River.  Upriver from the town, the Broland was known as 
The Upper River Broland.  Downriver it was known as the Lower River Broland.

name: Brous
description: Brous was a village on the Brous River in the Kingdom of Lether.  It was surrounded by a wooden palisade and protected by a small garrison commanded by Finadd Arlidas Tullid.

name: Brous River
description: The Brous River was located in northwestern Lether.  It ran from an area north of First Reach southwestward past Brous, Miner Sluice, and Bridle to the Domain Ocean.

name: Buck
description: Buck was a town at the mouth of the channel which connected Bucktooth Bay in the Malyn Sea with North Horsehead Lake and the city of Bettrys. Northeast of the town was Buck Swamp.

name: Buck Swamp
description: BuckSwamp was located in northwest Genabackis near the town of Buck. The swamp was fed by a river originating in the Central Malyn Range.

name: Buld
description: Buld was a city on the western coast of the Nap Sea in Itko Kan.  It lay south of Borid.  Further south on the coast was Then.

name: Burnout Wood
description: Burnout Wood was located north of the town Morass in northwestern Genabackis.

name: Burnt (town)
description: Burnt was a town located on a bay in eastern Assail. The town of Pillar was to its north while Run and Deep Root were to its south.

name: Bylah Bay
description: Bylah Bay was an area of the western Dojal Hading Sea on Seven Cities.  The bay's coast was lined by the cities of Bylan and Tarxian as well as the towns of Gresh, Nhelth, Rahl, and Thuryx.

name: Bylan
description: Bylan was a coastal city on the Dojal Hading Sea in Seven Cities. To the north was Nhelth and to the northwest were the Bylan'sh Hills.

name: Bylan'sh Hills
description: The Bylan'sh Hills ran eastward from Sanimon to the coast just north of Bylan in Seven Cities.

name: Bylt
description: Bylt was a city in western Quon Tali.  It was north of Aireck and southeast of the city of Quon Tali.

name: Ca'mon
description: Ca'mon was an ancient tel just west of the Gilar Oasis and east of the city of Caron Tepasi. Due south was another tel, Kalrmon.

name: Cabil
description: Cabil was a city in Falar located north the the Great Fenn Range and the city of Belade, on one of the smaller Falari Isles.

name: Cajale
description: Cajale was a former Free City to the east of the Owndos Sea (Lake Blued) in northern Genabackis. It was northeast of the city of Ostann.

name: Calash Sea
description: The Calash Sea, or Nepah Sea, was situated to the northwest of the continent of Lether, north of a long narrow peninsula known as "The Reach".

name: Callows
description: Callows was a city of thirty thousand residents on the southwest coast of the continent of Genabackis, which was known for its spices and perfumes.  It was a trader city and merchant's paradise whose harbour was filled with countless ships. Copper-sheathed domes, minarets, winding streets, and flower-filled balconies contributed to its overall beauty. Merchant trader ships from Callows were found anchored in Darujhistan.

name: Canhasan
description: Canhasan was one of several island cities in the Maadil Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent. Other nearby cities included Belbasi, Kaliban, and Karokitch.

name: Cant
description: The city of Cant was the capital of the Seguleh people, situated on the northern tip of the Isle of the Seguleh in southern Genabackis.

name: Canyon Lands
description: The Canyon Lands of Jacuruku lay between the Kingdom of the Thaumaturgs and the Desert of the Adwami Tribes.  They were a maze of bone-dry canyons, buttes, cliffs, and stony valleys running east-west from the shores of the Ocean of Storms to the Gangrek Range.  Washes in the Canyon Lands were sodden at night and dry by day.  They took more than a day to cross from north to south.

name: Cape Castle
description: Cape Castle was one of four promontories of land located on the southern tail of Genabackis. It extended into the Galatan Sweep between the cities of Bounty and Golden. To the northeast was Cape Refuge and to the southwest was Bluff Point.

name: Cape Refuge
description: Cape Refuge was one of four promontories of land located on the southern tail of Genabackis.  It extended into the Galatan Sweep between the cities of Golden and Refuge.  To the northeast was The Groan and to the southwest was Cape Castle.

name: Capustan
description: Capustan [Cap-oo-stan] was a small city on the north side of the river Catlin in the eastern region of Genabackis near the Rust Ocean.  The ancient city was founded by the once nomadic Capan tribes on lands that had been an ancestral Barghast burial ground.  The Capan tribes gathered in the area for trade and eventually become sedentary.

name: Carasin
description: Carasin was a city on the southern coast of Quon Tali facing the Bloor Sea. To its west was Vor and to its northeast was Aythan.

name: Cargo
description: Cargo was a small Letherii village in northwestern Lether.  Nearby were the villages of Brous, Denner, and Lan.

name: Caron Mountains
description: The Caron Mountains were situated on the eastern part of the continent of Seven Cities. Within the mountains was the Bakutalar Forest. To the north was the Sialk Odhan, to the west the Ubaryd Odhan, and to the east the Sahul Sea.

name: Caron Tepasi
description: Caron Tepasi was an inland city on the eastern shore of the Karas Sea.  It was ruled by a Malazan Fist.

name: Cast (city)
description: Cast was a city in Stygg. It was located on the west coast.

name: Cat
description: Cat (not to be confused with One Eye Cat) was a city in northern Genabackis, located north-west of Lead and south of the One Eye Mountains on the Old King Plateau.

name: Catch
description: Catch was a Letherii town in northern Lether on the coast of Katter Bight.  The city of Old Katter was to the northeast along the same coast and Dresh was directly to its south.

name: Cawn
description: Cawn was a large coastal city east of Li Heng on the continent of Quon Tali. It lay at the mouth of the Idryn river on an inlet off the Nap Sea known as the Bay of Nap. At one time, it may have been part of a greater kingdom known as Cawn Vor.

name: Cawn Sea
description: The Nap Sea lay between the Nap Isles and the eastern Quon Tali mainland. Some maps referred to this sea as the "Cawn Sea".

name: Central Malyn Range
description: The Central Malyn Range was part of a chain of mountains running east-west in northwestern  Genabackis.  Starting from the West Malyn Range, they ran east around the Laederon Plateau and the Lesser Laederon Plateau.  To the north was the Toblai Tundra.  To the south was Orbis, Redhouse, and Bettrys.

name: Children Ridge Mountains
description: The Children Ridge Mountains in the Lands of Fist surrounded the Tower Sea on Remnant Isle.

name: Chisel Coast
description: The northern shore of Malaz Island was known as the Chisel Coast.  In the east it was bordered by the White Mountains.

name: Cinnamon Wastes
description: The Cinnamon Wastes were an area southeast of Darujhistan and directly north of the territory controlled by the Pannion Domin. They were bordered on the south by the Godswalk Mountains.

name: City of Many Saints
description: The City of Many Saints was located on the eastern coast of the Sea of Gold on Assail. To its east was the Bone Range.

name: Clatar Sea
description: The Clatar Sea was a large inland body of water located on the south central portion of the continent of Seven Cities. To its west and northwest were found the Jhag Odhan, and the Jhena Mountains were found to its northeast. Cities on its shores included Nahal, Dobre, Geleen, and Sarsa.

name: Cloud Forest
description: Cloud Forest was home to the Moranth. It was situated on the north-west coast of Genabackis, and nestled in the Moranth Mountains. A fragment of Kurald Emurlahn was located here.

name: Coast of Dust
description: The Coast of Dust was the southern shore of the inland Dread Sea on Assail.

name: Colonus Sea
description: The Colonnus Sea lay to the northeast of the continent of Quon Tali. It was sandwiched between the Wickan Plains and the Great Fenn Range.  The city of Voron was located on its southern coast.

name: Companion Sea
description: The Companion Sea was a tiny inland sea just to the north of the Tower Sea on Remnant Isle. It was more the size of a lake.

name: Confederacy of Free Cities
description: The Confederacy of Free Cities, also known as the Southern Confederacy of Free Cities, was a loosely organized grouping of pirate city-states on Genabackis's southeastern peninsula.

name: Coral
description: Coral was a city on the east coast of Genabackis. Its citizens were referred to as Coralessians.

name: Coral Bay
description: Coral Bay lay to the south of the city of Coral and opened up into the Rust Ocean. It was fed by Ortnal's Cut

name: Coron Tepasi
description: Caron Tepasi was an inland city on the eastern shore of the Karas Sea.  It was ruled by a Malazan Fist.

name: Corpse Isle
description: Corpse Isle was one of the larger Night Ship Islands located at the tip of southern Genabackis' tail.  Nearby was Wreck Isle.

name: Crack Strait
description: The Crack Strait separated Korel Island from Remnant Isle and Dourkan to the east.

name: Cragg Sea
description: The Cragg Sea was a vast expanse of water to the south of Seven Cities and to the north of the Falari Isles.

name: Crest
description: The city of Crest was one of the two larger cities on the Harbinger Peninsula in northeastern Genabackis. It was situated on the southern shore of Crest Bay.

name: Cruk
description: Cruk was a city on the Lead Sea, an inland sea in northern Genabackis.  The River Toe exited the sea's northeastern coast at Cruk before crossing the Stannis Plain to Crest Bay.

name: Cullis
description: Cullis was a city in western Quon Tali.  It was east of the city of Quon Tali, and south of White and High Postern.

name: Culvern
description: Culvern, or Culvern Crossing, was a town in northwestern Genabackis along the Culvern River south of the Laederon Plateau and Silver Lake.  Torvald Nom called it "a latrine pit of a town" populated by the "scum of the Nathii".

name: Culvern River
description: The Culvern River ran from the mountains surrounding the Laederon Plateau in northwestern Genabackis southwards past Culvern. It fed into the Maly River which continued on to the Owndos Sea.

name: Cursed Lands
description: The Cursed Lands were located along the southwestern coast of Genabackis between the ruins of Morn and Ilem.

name: Cuttertown
description: Cuttertown, or Cutter Town, was a settlement just outside the southwestern wall of Darujhistan at Cutter Road Gate.  It lay at the intersection of Foss Road leading east to Ridge, Gadrobi Road leading northwest to a large cemetery and Maiten, and Cutter Lake Road leading southwest to the Dwelling Plain.

name: Cyral
description: Cyral was a city in southern Genabackis. It was located upriver from Elingarth and was likely a member of the Confederacy of Free Cities.  To its north over a mountain range was the Bay of No Harbour.

name: D'aliban
description: D'aliban was a nation on the continent of Lether. The land consisted of a peninsula on the southern coast of the continent, east of Sea Iban. To the north was the nation of Deal.

name: D'Avig
description: D'Avig was a town associated with the Untan noble family of the same name.  It lay on the frontier of the Wickan Plains.  Above the town was the D'Avig family's ancestral castle.  Further south on the Jurd River was the small Fortress Jurda.

name: D'rek Monastery
description: A D'rek Monastery was located on the southern coast of Malaz Island along the Strait of Storms.  It was located on the Taral Plain to the west of where the Pyre River exited into the strait.

name: D'rhasilhani
description: The D'rhasilhani were a people from the eastern part of the continent of Lether. They occupied the lands southeast of the Akrynnai. They were mainly known as horse-traders.

name: Dal Hon
description: The people who inhabited the Dal Hon Plains and the Forest Horn jungle were known as the Dal Honese. They were made up of various tribes and described as onyx-skinned. Those from the northern savannah tended to be taller and more willowy than those from the southern jungle.

name: Dal Hon Plains
description: The Dal Hon Plains were located in the southwest part of Quon Tali. This savannah region, along with the jungles of Forest Horn to the south, was the homeland of the Dal Honese. The plains were an area of rich grassland with young, fresh winds.

name: Dami
description: Dami was a city in western Jasston in the Lands of Fist. It was located on a bay facing westwards towards Ring Wall.

name: Damos
description: Damos was the westernmost city in the Empire of Jourilan which was in the south east of the Korel sub-continent. To the north was Damos Bay.

name: Damos Bay
description: Damos Bay was located at the southern tip of Korel Island, separating it from the Empire of Jourilan.

name: Danan
description: Danan was a city in Estobanse Province, Kolanse.  The Ses Mountains were to the north.

name: Dancer's Lament
description: Dancer's Lament is the first book in the early-empire trilogy, Path to Ascendancy, written by Ian C. Esslemont. It was released in the UK on the 25th of February 2016 and in the US on the 31st of May 2016.

name: Danig
description: Danig was a city on the southeastern coast of Theft on the Korel continent. It faced the Pirate's Sea. Across the Katakan border to the west was the city of Molz.

name: Darujhistan
description: Darujhistan [de-ruh-schistan] was the largest, most influential and last of the Free Cities on Genabackis. It had been called the "City of Cities" and was located on the southern shore of Lake Azur, in the centre of the continent.

name: Dass
description: Dass was a city on the western coast of Quon Tali near Nom Purge.  It was north of the cities of Quon Tali and Tellick, and south of Purage.

name: Dead Shore
description: The Dead Shore was the name of the coastline directly north of the Stormwall on Korel Island.

name: Deadhouse Gates
description: Deadhouse Gates is a novel by Steven Erikson. First released in 2000 in Great Britain and Canada, it was published by Tor in 2005 for the United States. It is the second book of ten in the Malazan Book of the Fallen series.

name: Deadhouse Landing
description: Deadhouse Landing is the second book in the Path to Ascendancy series by Ian C. Esslemont. It was released in the UK on the 16th of November 2017 and in the US on the 14th of November 2017.

name: Deal
description: Deal was a nation on the continent of Lether, north of D'aliban and southeast of Isthmus. A row of mountain forts defended the border with Isthmus.

name: Deal (city)
description: Deal was one of the two main cities in Deal, the nation of the same name on Lether.

name: Deep Root
description: Deep Root was a town in eastern Assail. The town of Burnt was to its north while Run was to its northwest.

name: Deep Well
description: Deep Well was a town near the southern shore of the Bay of Timber in Assail. It was located on the Bone Peninsula. To the southwest was the Bone Range and to the east was Wreckers' Coast and the Fear Narrows. To the north was Bones.

name: Deep Wilderness
description: The Deep Wilderness spanned the area south of the Ebon Mountains between the Elder Continent and the Bloodmare Ocean.

name: Deepwaters
description: Deepwaters was the northeastern region of the inland Dracons Sea on the continent of Lether.

name: Deland Valley
description: The Deland Valley was located in the center of Malaz Island north of the Ricker Mountains and west of Malaz City.  The towns of Grain, Monger, and Thal surrounded the valley.

name: Delans
description: Delanss (sometimes spelled Delans) was the capital city of the second most populous of the Falari Isles north of Quon Tali.  It was a closed, tightly knit society whose "capitulation to its Malazan invaders seemed to have amounted to no more than changing the colour of the flags atop the harbour fortress" although Talian was the land's unofficial second tongue.

name: Denard
description: Denard was a town located about halfway between the cities of Nahal and Dobre along the northeastern shore of the Clatar Sea in Seven Cities.  The Shenohl Forest bordered it to the west.  A river passed through Denard on its way from the Jhena Mountains to the sea.

name: Descent
description: Descent was a protectorate of the Letherii Empire situated to the south of Korshenn.

name: Deselen
description: Deselen was a city in western Lether.  It was located along the northern coast of the Dracons Sea near East Bay and Dracons.  To the east was Trails.

name: Desert of the Adwami Tribes
description: The Desert of the Adwami Tribes occupied the southwestern and central western lands of the Jacuruku continent.  It was bounded to the east by the Gangrek Range and to the north by the Canyon Lands and the Kingdom of the Thaumaturgs.  The desert was populated by a culture of horse riding tribes known as the Adwami, which often fought with each other.

name: Destruction
description: Destruction (or Destruction Bay) was a settlement on the southern shore of the Sea of Gold in Assail. It was located at the northern end of the Demon Narrows which led to the Dread Sea in the south.

name: Destry
description: Destry was a city on the western coast of Quon Tali.  It was west of Ebond and north of Korn.  To its north was Valan.

name: Deural
description: Devral was a city on the coast of the Dojal Hading Sea at the mouth of the River P'atha in Seven Cities. It was north of Asmar and east of Ubaryd. Nohl was across the bay to the southwest.

name: Dhavran
description: Dhavran was a city on the western shore of Lake Azur.

name: Dhebel
description: Dhebel was a city on a large island in the Dojal Hading Sea on Seven Cities.  It also bordered Seeker's Deep.

name: Dhurnal
description: Dhurnal was a town located north of the Clatar Sea on Seven Cities. It was one of several towns on a river that ran southwards to Geleen and the sea. Across the river and to the north was the town of Ehnal. A caravan track ran westwards from the town towards Dobre.

name: Dim (city)
description: Dim was a city on the west coast of Stygg.

name: Dobre
description: Dobre was a city located about halfway between the cities of Nahal and Geleen along the northeastern shore of the Clatar Sea in Seven Cities.

name: Dojal Hading Sea
description: The Dojal Hading Sea was found to the southeast of Seven Cities and northwest of Seeker's Deep. Important cities along its coast included Jamdat, Teppes, Asmar, Ubaryd, Bylan, Tarxian and Dhebel. Vathar Forest was also located on its northwestern edge.

name: Dojal Odhan
description: The Dojal Odhan was a plains area to the north of Aren and south of Tarxian.  It was crossed by the Aren Way.

name: Dolmens of Tien
description: The Dolmens of Tien were a series of stone pillars that stood like a forest of stone on a smooth, wind-scoured plain located by a bay at the northern-most tip of Jacuruku.  They were built of "stones carved to sit one atop the other, diminishing smoothly on six facets to a blunt tip" just over two man-heights tall.  Spaced about five paces apart, they continued inland from the shore as far as the eye could see.  Running in north-south and east-west rows they seemed to form "a series of nested arcs, or vast circles."  At the innermost ring of pillars lay an enormous circular plaza lined with pale stone carved to form ever-changing intricate patterns as the sun moved across the sky.

name: Domain Ocean
description: The Domain Ocean bounded the continent of Lether to the west and likely Assail to the east.

name: Dorik
description: Dorik was a city in western Skolati on the Korel continent. It was located where a channel left the Fist Sea on the way to the Pirate's Sea.

name: Dosin Pali
description: Dosin Pali was a city at the southern tip of Otataral Island across the strait from Hissar on the Seven Cities subcontinent. The island was known to hold one of the world's most prominent sources of otataral, and the city was the gateway to the mines that extracted the magic-deadening ore. It was no more than four days journey from the Skullcup mining camp.

name: Dour
description: Dour was the northernmost city in Dourkan. It was located where the Crack Strait met Bleeder's Cut.

name: Dourkan
description: Dourkan was situated between Korel Island and Remnant Isle, north of the Empire of Jourilan. It was separated from Korel Island by the Crack Strait and from Remnant Isle by Bleeder's Cut.

name: Dourkol
description: Dourkol was the capital of Dourkan, one of the Lands of Fist. It was centrally located.

name: Dracons
description: Dracons was a nation on the western coast of the continent of Lether. It consisted of an archipelago, the Pockface Islands, which separated the Dracons Sea from the Domain Ocean and the land on either side of the islands.

name: Dracons Sea
description: The Dracons Sea was an inland sea located in the southwest of the continent of Lether and likely to be identical with the Draconean Sea mentioned in Reaper's Gale.

name: Drak
description: Drak was one of the larger cities in Stygg. It was located on the east coast, along the Black Water Strait.

name: Dread Sea
description: The Dread Sea, or Sea of Dread, was a large glacial lake in northern Assail. It was formed by the meltwater of a receding Jaghut ice-field that once covered the region.

name: Dreaming Range
description: The Dreaming Range was located in northeastern Assail. It ran east-west, separating the Plain of Sighs from the Plain of Longing, and reached the Sea of Hate. Rivers from the mountains fed the Sea of Gold.

name: Drene
description: Drene was a territory and small city in northeastern Lether adjacent to the Awl'dan, on the east coast of the Bluerose Sea. Letur Anict was made Factor there in the latter days of King Ezgara Diskanar's rule. After the Tiste Edur conquered the Letherii Empire, Brohl Handar was made the Edur Overseer of the East in Drene.

name: Dresh
description: Dresh was a city in northwestern Lether at the mouth of the Moss River on the coast of Katter Bight. The city of Catch was directly to its north and Breeder's Wood was about half a day's walk to the southeast.

name: Drim
description: Drim was a city in southern Quon Tali.  It was east of Netor and west of Yellows.

name: Dryj Spring
description: Dryj Spring was located in the Sialk Odhan in eastern Seven Cities.   It was just northwest of Ladormon and the Lador Hills and southwest of Sialk. Vin'til Basin was to its north and the Tithansi Steppes to its west.

name: Dryjhna Ocean
description: The Dryjna Ocean was a large body of water to the northwest of Seven Cities. It also touched the Sepik Sea and the island on which was located the city of Sepik.

name: Dust of Dreams
description: Dust of Dreams is the ninth novel in the Malazan Book of the Fallen epic fantasy series. It was first published in Canada and the UK in 2009.

name: Dwelling Plain
description: The Dwelling Plain was a uninhabited, featureless, grassy landscape located on the continent of Genabackis to the south of Darujhistan. It was bordered to the east by the Cinnamon Wastes and to the south by the Plain of Lamatath. It is unclear from the map if the River Maiten was its westerly border or whether the Plain went beyond it. It was described as a vast sweeping landscape of nothing - with animal tracks but no animals, and vultures the only birds in the sky.

name: East Bay
description: East Bay was located on the northeastern coast of Dracons on the continent of Lether.  It opened onto the inland Dracons Sea.

name: East Elan Plain
description: The East Elan Plain was located in Kolanse to the west of Kolanse City and the Valley of Blessed Gift.  Gest Pass travelled through the mountains to the plain's north into Estobanse Province.  It was the home of the Elan.

name: East Shake River
description: The East Shake River was located in northwestern Lether.  It ran from the vicinity of Fort Shake southward to White Point and beyond.

name: East Watch
description: East Watch, or the Isle of East Watch, was an island in the Bloodmare Ocean off the eastern coast of the Lands of Fist. It was near the eastern entrance to the Blackwater Strait, the southern coast of Mare, and the eastern coast of the Deep Wilderness.

name: Eb
description: Eb was one of several cities located near the N'Trmon tel in eastern Seven Cities. It lay on the road between Narthi and Nitral. To the north were the Kundesh Hills and Uthor.

name: Ebon
description: Ebon was the northernmost city in Stygg. It was located on a peninsula which jutted between the Sender's Sea and the Black Water Strait. The city was an urban sprawl surrounding a great fortress. It was purported to possess some of the world's most legendary brothels, and the city's ruler maintained a pleasure palace.

name: Ebon Mountains
description: The Ebon Mountains formed a natural southern border for the region of Stygg. Farther south lay the Deep Wilderness.

name: Ebond
description: Ebond was a city on the western coast of Quon Tali.  It was across a bay from the city of Quon Tali.  Along the coast to its north was Valan.  To its southwest was Attic and to its south was Destry.

name: Ehnal
description: Ehnal was a town located north of the Clatar Sea on Seven Cities. It was one of several towns on a river that ran southwards to Geleen and the sea. Across the river and to the south was the town of Dhurnal. To the north was Penalh.

name: Ehrlitan
description: Ehrlitan was one of the Seven Holy Cities and a busy port on the Ehrlitan Sea in the northeast of the Seven Cities sub-continent. Its people were known as the Ehrlii.

name: Ehrlitan Sea
description: The Ehrlitan Sea was an expanse of water almost completely surrounded by land on the continent of Seven Cities. It was likely named for the holy city of Ehrlitan to its northeast. It joined the Otataral Sea via the A'rath Strait which ran to the west of Ehrlitan. The city of Kansu was at the northwest end of the sea, Pan'potsun to the south, and the Path'apur Mountains to the east.

name: Elder Continent
description: The Elder Continent was a region in the southern part of the subcontinent of Korel, between the Plains of Blight and the Deep Wilderness, north of the Iceback Range.

name: Elingarth
description: Elingarth was a city on the southeastern coast of the continent of Genabackis. It was located at the southern entrance of an inlet and connected by a road/track to North March. To the east it was bordered by the Lamatath Plain.

name: Elri
description: Elri was a city north of the Screaming Range in Korelri, itself named for this city and the city of Kor.

name: Empire of Lether
description: The denominations of the Letherii currency were the stripling, the dock, the level, the third, and the peak.

name: En Krael
description: En Krael was a city on the Seti Plains of Quon Tali.  It was northwest of Li Heng, west of Ifaran, and east of Bastial.

name: Ender
description: Ender was a city in Pilott, a small nation under the dominion of the Letherii.

name: Enjo Estarb
description: Enjo Estarb was a city in the northern portion of the continent of Seven Cities.  It was just to the north of the Thalas Mountains near the coast of the Maadil Sea.

name: Ero Lake
description: Ero Lake was a large body of water on the interior of the continent of Quon Tali. It lay on the eastern edge of Por Seti.

name: Eroug Basin
description: The Eroug Basin was located south of the Erougimon tel on Seven Cities.

name: Erougimon
description: Erougimon was an ancient tel just north of the Holy City of Aren. Nearby was the Eroug Basin.

name: Eryn
description: The River Eryn ran from the foot of the Vision Mountains south and east before joining Ortnal's Cut about twenty leagues northwest of the city of Coral. Its waters were red before plunging into the Cut's depths.

name: Estawn
description: Estawn was a city in southern Quon Tali.  It lay upriver from Shedry and Halas.  To the northeast was Bloor and to the east was Layes.

name: Estobanse Province
description: Estobanse Province was a valley province in Kolanse with vast mountains to the north and another range to the south, the sea to the east and the plains to the west. Fed by glacial streams and rivers, and sheltered from the hot winds of the south, it was the only province not suffering from the droughts that afflicted the southern kingdoms of Kolanse.

name: Evinor
description: Evinor was a former Free City on the northeastern coast of Genabackis. It was northeast of the Free City Plain.

name: Exile (city)
description: Exile was a town on the coast of south Genabackis. It was a member of the Confederacy of Free Cities, and likely the port mentioned by Circle Breaker as one of those from which the Freemen Privateers operated.

name: Exile Keep
description: Exile Keep was the fortress home of the Sharrs and the Sheers, two feuding families of decadent and inbred mages. It was located on the southwestern shore of the Dread Sea on Assail.

name: Explorer's Sea
description: The Explorer's Sea, (or the White Spires Ocean or the White Spires Sea), was the southernmost ocean in the world of the Malazan Book of the Fallen.  White Spires derived from the islands of floating ice that threatened mariners.

name: Falair
description: Falair was a city in Falar located north the the Great Fenn Range and west of Cabil and Belade.

name: Falar
description: Falar, or the Falar subcontinent, was made up of the Falari Isles located off the north-eastern coast of Quon Tali and the peninsula north of Great Fenn Range. It was under the rule of the Malazan Empire which had crushed their fleets in a series of great naval battles.

name: Falari Sea
description: The Falari Sea lay to the northeast of the continent of Quon Tali and east of the Falari subcontinent.

name: Fall Isle
description: Fall Isle was a small island in the Rust Ocean off the east coast of Genabackis.  It lay south of the Harbinger Peninsula and east of Taph.

name: Fall Strait
description: Fall Strait was north of Remnant Isle on the Lands of Fist. It connected the Sender's Sea to the Narrows and Crack Strait near Theft.

name: Falt
description: Falt was a city in northeastern Skolati on the Korel continent. It was located between the coast of the Bloodmare Ocean and the mountains circling the Fist Sea.

name: Fedal
description: Fedal was a city in Itko Kan near the coast of the Horn Ocean. It lay just east of Forest Horn and north of Horan. To the northeast was Nex and to the southeast was Ryns.

name: Feint
description: Feint was one of the cities in Truce on the continent of Lether. It was located in the north-east of the country.

name: Feng
description: Feng was a city near the western coast of the Nap Sea in Itko Kan.  To its northeast was the city of Aska.  To the southeast was Borid.  The great city of Li Heng was to its west.

name: Fenn Mountains
description: The Great Fenn Range was a mountain range located on the northern part of the continent of Quon Tali. To the north of the Range lay the Ice Fields and part of the subcontinent of Falar, to its south was Forest Fenn, to the southwest Nom Purge, to the west the Horn Ocean, and to the east the Colonnus Sea. The most populous inhabitants were the Fenn.

name: Fent Reach
description: Fent Reach was a fortified Letherii city on the  Reach penninsula overlooking the Katter Sea in northwest Lether. It was commanded by Atri-Preda Yan Tovis. It was defended by the Fent Garrison.

name: Filk
description: Filk was a city on the eastern coast of Theft on the Korel continent. It faced the Pirate's Sea.

name: Fire
description: Fire was a large city in the south of Dracons.

name: First Landing
description: First Landing was a town on the northeastern coast of the Sea of Gold on Assail.

name: First Maiden Fort
description: First Maiden Fort was one of three fortresses in northwestern Lether which defended the mouth of Katter Bight.  The other two fortresses were Second Maiden Fort and Third Maiden Fort.

name: First Reach
description: First Reach was a town in the northwestern region of the Letherii Empire.  It was located on a low, flat floodplain on the Brous River. Downriver was the village of Brous and the city of Miner Sluice.  To the north was the settlement of Thetil.

name: Firstsight Mountains
description: The Firstsight Mountains were located in west central Malaz Island along the southern edge of the T'kanas Forest.  The range ran into the Ricker Mountains to the east and was the source of the North and South Malaz Rivers as well as the West River.  In the southern foothills of the mountains were tin mines.

name: Fist Island
description: Fist Island was an island northeast of Korel Island, and part of the continent of Lands of Fist.

name: Fist Sea
description: The Fist Sea, or Sea of Fist, was an inland sea on Fist Island which lay between Skolati to the north and east, and Rool to the south and west. Along its southern shore was the Trembling Range which hid the caves of the mountain ascetics at Thol. It was connected to the Pirate's Sea to the west by a channel.

name: Five Points
description: Five Points was a Letherii town in northwestern Lether.  It was located between Brans Keep and White Point on the western side of the East Shake River.

name: Flint Plain
description: The Flint Plain covered the northeast region of Malaz Island.  It was bordered by the White Mountains to the north and North and South Malaz Rivers to the south.

name: Flow Strait
description: The Flow Strait was located to the northwest of Jasston and southeast of Remnant Isle, providing access to The Curl.

name: Fool's River
description: Malybridge was a town in northwestern Genabackis. It was located south of the Lesser Laederon Plateau. The West Fool's River passed the city on its way southward to Marktown.  It was similar in size to Ninsano Moat,  and was seventeen days' journey by slow moving cart to Tanys on the coast of the Malyn Sea.

name: Fools
description: Fools was a city on the eastern coast of Quon Tali facing the Bloor Sea. To its west was Unta, the capital of the Malazan Empire. To its northeast was Haljhen.

name: Forest Fenn
description: Forest Fenn was located on the northern portion of the continent of Quon Tali. It was bordered on the north by the Great Fenn Range, and to the south by Nom Purge and Por Seti. Inhabitants included the Fenn.

name: Forest Horn
description: Forest Horn was located on the southwest portion of the continent of Quon Tali, and along with the savannah of the Dal Hon Plains to the north, was the homeland of the Dal Honese.  The word "forest" may have been a misnomer as the area was referred to as jungle by both Heboric and the Dal Hon shaman, Yune. To the Forest Horn's east, west, and south lay the Horn Ocean. The region's southwestern-most point was known as The Horn.

name: Forest Kril
description: The Forest Kril was located on the southeastern coast of Malaz Island.  It was surrounded to the north, west, and south by the South Plain.

name: Fort Drii
description: Fort Drii was situated on the eastern shore of the Fist Sea in Skolati.

name: Fort Shake
description: Fort Shake was a defensive fortification on the northern frontier of the Kingdom of Lether.  It was to the east of High Fort.  Nearby, to the southwest, was The Manse.

name: Free City Plain
description: The Free City Plain was located in northeastern Genabackis. The rivers Gend and Sogen ran through it leading to outlets which emptied into the Rust Ocean near the city of Apple. The Free City Plain was under the control of the Malazan Empire at the beginning of Gardens of the Moon.

name: G'danisban
description: G'danisban was a small city on the northeastern part of the Seven Cities continent near Pan'potsun. It was found on the eastern border of the holy desert of Raraku where it abutted the Pan'potsun Odhan.  The residents were known as the G'danii.

name: Gadrobi Hills
description: The Gadrobi Hills were a range of  sparsely inhabited hills east of the city of Darujhistan that were once the home of the Gadrobi people.

name: Galatan Island
description: Galatan Island was a large island off the southern coast of Genabackis in the Galatan Sweep.  Its principle settlement was New Landing on the island's western coast, which was likely a member of the Confederacy of Free Cities.  On the opposite end of the island was Four Towers Ruins.

name: Galatan Sweep
description: The Galatan Sweep  lay off the southeastern coast of Genabackis, east of the Rivan Sea, surrounding the 'fluke islands' of Genabackis and lining the shore of the Confederacy of Free Cities.

name: Galladi
description: Galladi was an island city in the Sea of Gallada on the Seven Cities subcontinent. Across the water to the west was the Holy City of Karakarang.

name: Gangrek Mounts
description: The Gangrek Mounts, also known as the Fangs or Dragon's Fangs, were a mountain range that split Jacuruku between its East and West. The mountains were comprised of limestone, with the terrain containing many sheer cliffs, mires, deep cracks and sinkholes, some with lakes enclosed within them. They were somewhat smaller than regular mountains. The range was where the jungle began and was used as a formal border between the Kingdom of the Thaumaturgs and the lands ruled by Ardata - the Jungle of Himatan.

name: Gangrek Range
description: The Gangrek Mounts, also known as the Fangs or Dragon's Fangs, were a mountain range that split Jacuruku between its East and West. The mountains were comprised of limestone, with the terrain containing many sheer cliffs, mires, deep cracks and sinkholes, some with lakes enclosed within them. They were somewhat smaller than regular mountains. The range was where the jungle began and was used as a formal border between the Kingdom of the Thaumaturgs and the lands ruled by Ardata - the Jungle of Himatan.

name: Ganiss
description: Nisst was a city on the continent of Genabackis that was part of the alliance of Free Cities resisting the Malazan Empire's invasion of the continent.

name: Garal
description: Garal was a city in western Quon Tali.  It was located on a river that travelled south to Forest Horn.   To its north was Aireck.

name: Gardens of the Moon
description: Gardens of the Moon is the first novel in the Malazan Book of the Fallen epic fantasy series. It was written by Steven Erikson in 1991 and extensively revised over several years before first being published by Bantam Books on April 1, 1999 in Great Britain and Canada. In 2000, it was nominated for a World Fantasy Award as one of the year's best fantasy novels.  On December 28, 2004, Tor Books released it in the United States, and it has since been re-released in multiple editions and in many countries.

name: Garnih Hill
description: Garnih Hill was located in the Nenoth Odhan on Seven Cities. It was northeast of the Uhlimon tel.

name: Gast
description: Gast was a city on the southeastern coast of Quon Tali facing the Bloor Sea. To its southwest was Nure and to its northeast was Yellows.

name: Gedry
description: Gedry was a city in western Lether on the coast of the Ouster Sea.  It lay at the mouth of the Lether River which emptied into Gedry Bay, and was a three day journey downriver from Letheras, the capital of the Kingdom of Lether. To the west was Roster and to the northwest was Harness.

name: Geleen
description: Geleen was a city at the northeastern end of the Clatar Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent.

name: Geleen Plain
description: The Geleen Plain, or grasslands, lay between the Dojal Hading Sea and the inland Clatar Sea on the continent of Seven Cities. On the plain itself was the home of the Kherahn Dhobri. To the north of the grasslands was the ancestral home of the Pardu tribe.

name: Gelor Ridge
description: Gelor Ridge was situated south of Halaf on the Seven Cities subcontinent overlooking the western end of a dry lakebed through which the River P'atha flowed.

name: Genabackis
description: Genabackis was a continent where much of the plot in the first books of the Malazan Book of the Fallen series took place. It was one of the larger continents on the planet.

name: Genabaris
description: Genabaris was a large coastal city in northernwestern Genabackis. The port city was held by the Malazan Empire and was a main debarking point for imperial armies during the Genabackis campaign. According to Paran, it was a thousand leagues from Pale, although this may have been a figure of speech.

name: Genabaris Bay
description: Ganoes Stabro Paran [Gan-ohs Pah-ran] was the eldest son of House Paran of Unta. He was born in Unta, the capital of the Malazan Empire, in the 1142nd year of Burn's Sleep.

name: Genalle
description: Genalle was a former Free City on the River Gend in northeastern Genabackis.  Conquered by the Malazan Empire, the city was ruled by a Malazan governor.

name: Geni
description: Geni was an island south of the continent of Quon Tali.  The island's coast was largely wild and unsettled, but it did support a population of fishermen.

name: Gest Pass
description: Gest Pass connected Estobanse Province to the East Elan Plain through a mountain range on Kolanse.

name: Ghost City
description: Ghost City was located on the southern tip of Remnant Isle, on the Bleeder's Cut, just north of the Ring Wall.

name: Gilar Oasis
description: The Gilar Oasis was located approxmiately halfway between Sialk and Caron Tepasi. Due west was the ancient tel of Ca'mon and southwest, the tel Kalrmon. To the north Gryvar Pass crossed an unnamed set of hills.

name: Glass Desert
description: The Glass Desert was located to the east of the continent Lether in the western part of Kolanse. It was said to be impassable due to the almost complete absence of water and life.

name: Gnet Monastery
description: The ancient Gnet Monastery was situated on a pinnacle overlooking the southeastern edge of a dry lakebed through which the River P'atha flowed near Gelor Ridge. It was described as a fortress which was likely dedicated to one of the Seven Holies, the patron Ascendants of Seven Cities.

name: Gods Walk Mountains
description: The Godswalk Mountains in Genabackis were considered a young mountain range and quite jagged. They bordered the southern edge of the Cinnamon Wastes.

name: Golden
description: Golden was a city on the coast of south Genabackis. It was a member of the Confederacy of Free Cities.  To its west was Bounty and to its east was Refuge.

name: Golk
description: Golk was a town located in the southwestern part of the Empire of Jourilan, west of Pon-Ruo and northeast of Antr.

name: Goss
description: Goss was sergeant of the 17th Squad, 4th Company, 2nd Division of the Malazan Fourth Army and veteran of Seven Cities. His nickname was Hunter, which for the old veterans was code for a Claw. Because he had served all his life, was nearing his fiftieth year, and was new to the regulars the rumour was he had been a Claw before his current assignment.  Even the squad's killer, the scout Faro, deferred to Goss' judgement.

name: Gost
description: Gost was a city in southeastern Skolati on the Korel continent. It was located near the coast of the Bloodmare Ocean.

name: Grain
description: Grain was a town in eastern Malaz Island located to the southwest of Malaz City.  A road led westward through the Deland Valley to Monger and Thal.

name: Great Barrow
description: The Barrow of the Redeemer, also known as the Great Barrow and Itkovian's Gift, was located just outside the city of Coral.

name: Great Fenn Range
description: The Great Fenn Range was a mountain range located on the northern part of the continent of Quon Tali. To the north of the Range lay the Ice Fields and part of the subcontinent of Falar, to its south was Forest Fenn, to the southwest Nom Purge, to the west the Horn Ocean, and to the east the Colonnus Sea. The most populous inhabitants were the Fenn.

name: Great Reefs
description: The Great Reefs ran along Malaz Island's northeastern shore.  They reached as far south as Malaz Bay outside of Malaz City.

name: Gredfallan
description: Gredfallan, also spelled Gredfalan, was a city on the southern shore of Lake Azur, about half-way between Darujhistan and Dhavran.

name: Green River
description: Green River formed the northern boundary of the peninsula containing Black Fingers Forest on Assail. It originated in the Grey Stone mountains and fed into the Sea of Hate.

name: Greenwater Lake
description: Greenwater Lake lay in north central Genabackis.  Its western shore abutted the mountains of Moranth Forest.  To its east was the Rhivi Plain.

name: Gresh
description: The town of Gresh was located on the coast of Bylah Bay on Seven Cities. Bylan lay to the north and Rahl to the south.

name: Gress
description: Gress was one of the cities in Truce on the continent of Lether. It was located on the shore of Gress Bay, in the Dracons Sea.  To the west was the city of Trails.

name: Gress Bay
description: Gress Bay was located on the northeastern shore of the inland Dracons Sea on the continent of Lether. It lay between the cities of Gress and Obertull in the nation of Truce.  The bay was fed by a river originating in the mountains far to the northeast near Bluerose.

name: Grest
description: Grest was a city on the northeastern coast of Theft on the Korel continent. It faced the Pirate's Sea.

name: Grey Stone
description: Grey Stone was a range of mountains on Assail on the northern edge of Black Fingers Forest. The Green River appeared to originate there. To its west were the Shifting Wastes.

name: Greydog
description: Greydog was a town on the eastern end of the lake of the same name. It was about 20 leagues east of the town of Mott.

name: Greydog Lake
description: Greydog Lake was situated between the towns of Mott and Greydog in Mott Wood.

name: Greydog Wood
description: Greydog Wood was located in northwestern Genabackis south of the Grinning Face Hills and north of Greydog.  The forest was the northwesternmost region of the Sorol Forest.

name: Grinning Face Hills
description: The Grinning Face Hills were located in northwestern Genabackis, east of the Malyn Sea, between the Grinning Face and Owndos Ranges.

name: Grinning Face Range
description: The Grinning Face Range was located in northwestern Genabackis, south of the Malyn Sea.

name: Gris
description: Gris was a northern province of Quon Tali. It was also the name of a city on the northeastern coast. Like the Untans, Grisians were characterised by their burly frames and wavy hair.

name: Grove
description: Grove was a town nearly surrounded by woods on the eastern coast of Malaz Island. A road led westward across the South Plain to Three Roads.  To the north were the White Butte Hills.

name: Gryvar Pass
description: Gryvar Pass crossed an unnamed set of hills north of Gilar Oasis in eastern Seven Cities.

name: Guran
description: Guran was an ancient inland city on the subcontinent of Seven Cities. It was a major trade center on the southwestern shore of the Karas Sea, roughly halfway between Halaf and Caron Tepasi.

name: Habal
description: Habal was a city in northeastern Quon Tali. To its north was Baran and to its south was Balstro.

name: Haft
description: Haft was a city in southern Skolati on the Korel continent. It was located on a river leading into the Fist Sea.

name: Halaf
description: Halaf was an ancient city and major trading center on the P'atha river, about halfway between Karaschimesh and Ubaryd in Seven Cities. To the northeast were the Karas Hills and the Karas Sea.

name: Halas
description: Halas was a city on the eastern coast of the Nap Sea in southern Quon Tali.  It lay downriver from Shedry and Estawn.  Further west on the coast was the city of Cawn.  To the southeast was Marl.

name: Haljhen
description: Haljhen was a city on the eastern coast of Quon Tali facing the Bloor Sea. It was located across the River Nye from Gris to its east. To its southwest was Fools.

name: Haneb
description: Haneb was a town at the eastern end of the Clatar Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent.

name: Hantvesta Forest
description: Hantvesta Forest was located on the west coast of Malaz Island.  It lined the hills along the southern coast of Karo Bay.  The road between Karo and Jakata passed its eastern border.

name: Hara
description: Hara was a town on Seven Cities that was located north of the Karas Sea and the Holy City of Karashimesh.  Vrek was to its east and T'nal to its northeast.

name: Harbinger Peninsula
description: The Harbinger Peninsula was located in northeastern Genabackis, bounded to the north by Crest Bay. The main settlements on the peninsula were Shand and Crest.

name: Harness
description: Harness was a city in the Letherii Empire.  It was located west of the Lether River near Gedry.

name: Hatra
description: Hatra was a city in the northern portion of the continent of Seven Cities.  It was just to the north of the Thalas Mountains near the coast of the Maadil Sea.  To its north was Kot Ghul.

name: Heath
description: The city of Heath lay on the southern shore of Pilgrim Lake within the former territory of the Pannion Domin. It was located across the River Heath from the Pannion Seer's former fortress at Outlook.

name: Heath (river)
description: The River Heath traveled northward from southern Genabackis to Pilgrim Lake in the central west portion of the continent. The river entered the lake near the city of Outlook and the town of Heath.

name: Hetok
description: Hetok was a city in Estobanse Province, Kolanse.

name: High Fort
description: High Fort was a major Letherii defensive fortification on the Kingdom of Lether's frontier with the lands of the Tiste Edur.  It guarded the route to the mountain pass leading into Edur territory.  Apart from its own rotating garrison, the Grass Jackets Brigade and Whitefinder Battalion were normally stationed there as well.

name: High Postern
description: High Postern was a city in western Quon Tali near Lake Seti.  It was east of the cities of Quon Tali and White, and west of Seti.

name: Hissar
description: Hissar was a city on the eastern coast of the Seven Cities continent. It lay at the feet of the Sahul Sea, while the Sialk Odhan was to its west. Across the strait was Dosin Pali.

name: Hole Hills
description: The Hole Hills were located in northwestern Genabackis, south of the Grinning Face Range.  They bordered Water Reach Wood.

name: Holly
description: Holly was a town on the northeastern coast of Assail along the Bay of Timber. It was ruled by Countess Iren.

name: Homdo
description: Homdo was a city near the northwest border of the Kingdom of Rool.

name: Hoop
description: Hoop was a former Free City north of the Free City Plain in northeastern Genabackis.

name: Horan
description: Horan was a town on an island in the Rust Ocean off the northeast coast of  Genabackis.  It was to the east of the former Free Cities of Hoop and Evinor.

name: Horan (Quon Tali)
description: Horan was a city in Itko Kan on the coast of the Horn Ocean.  It lay just east of Forest Horn and west of Bathi. To the north was Fedal.

name: Horn Ocean
description: Horn Ocean was located to the southwest of the continent of Quon Tali. During the events of the Malazan Book of the Fallen, it was the most recent location for the moving island Drift Avalii.

name: House of Chains
description: House of Chains is the fourth book in the Malazan Book of the Fallen. It was released in the UK and Canada in January 2002 and in the US August 2006 by Tor.

name: Hudd Sea
description: The Hudd Sea was located to the north of the continent of Genabackis.  The Toblai Tundra and the Northwind Tundra ran along its coast.

name: Hurl (location)
description: Hurl was a town at the northeastern end of the Clatar Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent.

name: Hurly
description: Hurly was a decrepit fishing village in South Genabackis that was mostly destroyed by the tidal waves created when Moon's Spawn crashed into the RivanÂ Sea.Â Eventually the town was turned into a way stop for thieves and treasure hunters, wreckers and pirates,Â on their way to the remnants of Moon's Spawn which, after crashing into the sea, had created a series of islands rumored to contain riches beyond imagining.

name: Hyacinth Passage
description: Hyacinth Passage was an inland channel between the Dracons Sea and Hyacinth Reach. To the north lay Karn and to the south, Isthmus.

name: Hyacinth Reach
description: Hyacinth Reach was an inland channel bounded to the north by Karn and Truce and to the south by Isthmus. To the west was Hyacinth Passage which led to the Dracons Sea.

name: Hyjhan
description: Hyjhan was a town at the eastern end of the Clatar Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent.

name: Hyryb
description: Hyryb was a town north of the Menykh River and Rhegh Forest on Seven Cities.  It was located in the hills between Aren and Rhegh.

name: Ice Island Sea
description: The Ice Island Sea was the southwestern portion of the Bloodmare Ocean off the eastern coast of Korel. It bordered the frozen tundra separating Korel from Stratem.

name: Iceback Range
description: The Iceback Range formed the southern border of the Lands of Fist. Farther south lay tundra and the icefields of Stratem.

name: Idryb
description: Idryb was a Quon Talian city on the Idryn river between Li Heng and Ipras. To the northwest was Ifaran.

name: Ifaran
description: Ifaran was a trading outpost on the Seti Plains of Quon Tali.  It was north of Li Heng and Idryb, and to the east of En Krael.

name: Ijor
description: Ijor was a city in Itko Kan west of the Nap Sea.  To the north was Traly and to the southwest was Nex.

name: Ilem
description: Illem was a city on the continent of Genabackis along the coast of the Rivan Sea. It was to the west of March.

name: Illem
description: Illem was a city on the continent of Genabackis along the coast of the Rivan Sea. It was to the west of March.

name: Inside Passage
description: The Inside Passage was the waterway separating a chain of islands from the southwestern coast of Malaz Island.  The strait passed both Break Island and Jakata.

name: Ipras
description: Ipras was a Quon Talian city located where the Brittlewash joined the Idryn river between Cawn and Idryb.  To the north was Telo.

name: Iri'shimon
description: Iri'shimon was an ancient tel located southeast of the city of Caron Tepasi and west of Dryj Spring.

name: Isana Pura
description: Isana Pura was the southern capital of the Kingdom of the Thaumaturgs, holding this position as it was also its ritual centre. The city itself was located in a valley, with its surrounds encompassing a large amount of fields or other agriculturally based areas, with a complex irrigation system as a part of it. The larger city area was approximated to house one million citizens, with the city's streets being like a maze as the many squat buildings were constructed similarly. Towards the centre of the city lay a larger compound, home to the city's Thaumaturg masters, which was also identifiable from its towers, bell-shaped and pointed, yet domed.

name: Isle of the Seguleh
description: Seguleh Island was located directly south of Morn off the southwestern coast of Genabackis. It was home to the Seguleh, a warrior people.

name: Isthmus
description: Isthmus was a nation on the continent of Lether. It separated Sea Iban from Hyacinth Reach. It was bordered to the west by Pilott and T'roos and to the east by Deal.  Its northernmost extension was Blueglow Point.

name: Itko Kan
description: Itko Kan was a coastal region east of the Dal Hon Plains, on Quon Tali. The distance to Unta was described as being about 300 leagues (likely to mean travelling distance by horse). The capital city was called Kan. Recognizable traits of the Kanese people included olive skin, eyes with epicanthic folds, and black hair. The Kanese had a reputation for not being 'exactly excitable' and Ganoes Paran described them as being co-operative folk.

name: Jacuruku
description: The continent of Jacuruku was a small island-continent located south-west of Stratem and Korel, south of Quon Tali and Seven Cities and east of Lether. It was divided in two by the Gangrek Range, with deserts lying to the west and thick jungles to the east.

name: Jakal Viharn
description: The legendary city of Jakal Viharn was Ardata's centre of power, located deep within the Jungle of Himatan.  The city was also known as the "city of gold", as it allegedly - beyond being the richest city in the world - was more abundant in gold than any other area, being so opulent that streets themselves were supposedly paved in jewels. There were many rumours surrounding the city, some stating that those who reached it could gain immortality or great power, as Ardata herself would supposedly grant a boon to pilgrims there.
