These rumours even reached as far as Cant, the city of the Seguleh - a people notorious for their reticence and xenophobia.  Traveling to the city was no easy task.  Ardata's powers prevented entry by Warren, so anyone making the attempt had to brave the Himatan by foot or boat.

name: Jakata
description: Jakata (also Jakatakan - see section below) was a city on the southwestern coast of Malaz Island which was known for its seafaring people, notably pirates. Jakata was referred to as Jakatan as well, but the name (in that form) was used only once in the Malazan main series by Steven Erikson (in "The Crippled God"), but it was used several times in Ian C. Esslemont's "Night of Knives".

name: Jakatakan
description: Malaz Island, also known as Jakatakan or Malaz Isle, was an island to the southeast of Quon Tali and the northwest of Korel.  There were two cities on the Island, Malaz City and Jakata, as well as several smaller towns and settlements.

name: Jallid Plain
description: The Jallid Plain covered the southwestern region of Malaz Island.  It was separated from the Taral Plain to the east by the Rust Hills.  The River Broland crossed the plain in the northwest.  The towns of Broland Meet, Losten, Jakata, and Upper Jakata were located in or around the plain

name: Jamdat
description: Jamdat was a city on a peninsula jutting into the Dojal Hading Sea on Seven Cities.  It lay south of Bakun and the Caron Mountains.

name: Jasp
description: Jasp was a city in Bluerose on the northwestern coast of the Bluerose Sea.  To the northeast was Outbound.

name: Jassr
description: Jassr was a city in northern Jasston in the Lands of Fist. It was located on the point of land where the Flow Strait met The Curl.

name: Jasston
description: Jasston was a peninsula between the Empire of Jourilan and the Plains of Blight, bounded to the north by the Flow Strait.

name: Jh'ankh
description: Jh'ankh was a town east of the Clatar Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent.  It was located between the Jhemon tel to the north and the Kahr tel to the south.

name: Jhag Odhan
description: The Jhag Odhan [Jag ÅŒ-dan] were wastes which lay to the west of Seven Cities between the Olphara Forest and the inland Clatar Sea. It was bordered on the west by Nemil.

name: Jhemon
description: Jhemon was a tel in Seven Cities.

name: Jhena Mountains
description: The Jhena Mountains were found on the central portion of the continent of Seven Cities. To their north and northwest was the Ugarat Odhan, to their southwest was the city of Nahal and the Clatar Sea, to their southeast was Vathar Forest, and to their east was the Ubaryd Odhan.

name: Jour
description: Jour was the capital city of the Empire of Jourilan. It was located at the base of Damos Bay on the Empire's northwestern border.

name: Jourilan
description: The Empire of Jourilan was located in the southwest of the Korel sub-continent, just south of Dourkan and west of Jasston. It bordered on Damos Bay to the northwest and was bounded to the east by Blight Sea. Its capital was Jour.

name: Jungle of Himatan
description: The Jungle of Himatan was a vast area covering eastern Jacuruku, beyond the Gangrek Range, neighbouring both the Kingdom of the Thaumaturgs and the Desert of the Adwami Tribes. The Himatan was ruled by Ardata, sometimes named the Demon- or Night-Queen, while its populace was made up of her "children" - a number of creatures no longer found in the rest of the world, although some humans also resided there. The Dolmens of Tien lay in the far north of the region, while the somewhat mythical Jakal Viharn was situated in the northern region also, deep within the jungle itself. The jungle also included coastal regions, comprising of parts along the Ocean of Storms and the White Spires Sea.

name: Jurda
description: Fortress Jurda was a small fortification in northeastern Quon Tali on the Jurd River upriver from Unta.  It was home to the Jurda family and its commander was Lord Jurda.

name: Kahr
description: Kahr was an ancient tel on the southern extremity of the Geleen Plain, just north of the city of Ahnkahr  in Seven Cities.

name: Kahr Hills
description: The Kahr Hills were located northeast of the city of Sarsa, east of the Clatar Sea in southeastern Seven Cities.

name: Kaliban
description: Kaliban was one of several island cities in the Maadil Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent. Other nearby cities included Belbasi, Canhasan, and Karokitch.

name: Kalrmon
description: Kalrmon was an ancient tel southwest of the Gilar Oasis and east of the city of Caron Tepasi. Due north was another tel, Ca'mon.

name: Kansu
description: Kansu was a squalid port city with six piers on the northwest extremity of the Ehrlitan Sea.  Within the city was a Temple of D'rek where the area's foremost healers could be found. The inland road leading from the city was crowded with a sprawl of shanties before opening to herd lands and Tharok orchards.  The Kansu Reach ran eastward from the city along the A'rath Strait.

name: Karakarang
description: Karakarang was one of the Holy Cities of Seven Cities. It was located on Otataral Island in the northeast part of the continent. Specifically, it lay on an outjut of land bordered by the Talgai Sea on the west, the Bandiko Sea to the north, and the Sea of Gallada to the east.

name: Karas Hills
description: The Karas Hills began just south of Karaschimesh and ran along the western shore of the inland Karas Sea extending west toward the city of Sem'k on the Seven Cities continent.

name: Karas Sea
description: The Karas Sea was a small inland sea west of the Sahul Sea on the continent of Seven Cities. On the north shore was the holy city of Karashimesh. It was fed from the Sekala river to the south.

name: Karashimesh
description: Karashimesh (or Karaschimesh) was one of Seven Cities' holy cities. It was an ancient city located on the northern shore of the Karas Sea.

name: Karn
description: Karn was a protectorate of the Letherii Empire on the continent of Lether. It was located south of Truce at the eastern end of the Dracons Sea on the Hyacinth Passage.

name: Karo
description: Karo was a city on the west coast of Malaz Island.  It was centred on Karo Bay between the T'kanas Forest to the north and the Hantvesta Forest to the south. A road travelling south from Karo forked before proceeding on to Broland Meet in the southeast and Jakata in the south.

name: Karo Bay
description: Karo Bay was located on the western coast of Malaz Island and was part of Reacher's Ocean.  It was likely named for the city of Karo which occupied its centre.

name: Karokitch
description: Karokitch was one of several island cities in the Maadil Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent. Other nearby cities included Belbasi, Canhasan, and Kaliban.

name: Kartool
description: Kartool City was located on Kartool Island, off the east coast of Quon Tali. It was known for its impressive population of deadly fist-sized paralt spiders whose webs festooned the city's score of towers. Gulls and pigeons could often be spotted entangled in the paralt's webs and the arachnids' moult-skins and web-fragments polluted the city's murky harbour. The city was bordered by a ring of limestone cliffs. Citizens dressed as giant spiders during the Paralt Festival.

name: Kartool Island
description: Kartool Island was located north of Malaz Island, off the east coast of Quon Tali, separated from the mainland by the Bloor Sea. The capital of Kartool Island was the city of Kartool.

name: Karyx
description: Karyx was a city in the Pockface Islands in Dracons.

name: Katakan
description: Katakan was a region on Korel Island sandwiched between the Barrier Range and Korelri to the south and Theft to the north.

name: Katter
description: The Katter River was located in northwestern Lether.  It ran from the mountains near High Fort westward to empty into the Katter Bight at Old Katter.

name: Katter Bight
description: Katter Bight, or Katter Sea, was a stretch of water in northwestern Lether outside Old Katter. It was separated from the Domain Ocean by string of islands known as the Three Maidens which each had a fort.

name: Katter River
description: The Katter River was located in northwestern Lether.  It ran from the mountains near High Fort westward to empty into the Katter Bight at Old Katter.

name: Kayhum
description: Kayhum was a major city located south of the Thalas Mountains on Seven Cities.  The River Ugarat that passed the town continued southwards to Ugarat.  To the northwest of the city was Y'Ghatan.

name: Keff
description: The cities of Keff and Stunra lay at the crossroads of several caravan tracks on Seven Cities.  Trade from Asmar, Guran, Halaf, and Rathar passed through these two locations.

name: Kel Tor
description: Kel Tor was a city within the territory of the Pannion Domin. It was located to the southwest of Pilgrim Lake.

name: Kellanved's Reach
description: Kellanved's Reach is the title for the third book in Ian C. Esslemont's Path to Ascendancy series. It is the sequel to Deadhouse Landing and takes place about one month after the events of that novel.

name: Kevil
description: Kevil was a port city on the Black Water Strait at the southern tip of the kingdom of Mare on the Island of Fist.

name: Khundryl Odhan
description: The Khundryl Odhan was situated just south of Vathar Forest and northwest of the Nenoth Odhan. It was the home of the Khundryl people.

name: King Call's Isle
description: King Call's Isle was among the fluke islands at the tip of southern Genabackis' tail.  It was located between Bad Luck Isle and The Groan on the Genabackis mainland.

name: Kingdom of the Thaumaturgs
description: TheÂ Kingdom of the ThaumaturgsÂ was a misnomer, as it was not actually a kingdom but a mageocracy led by the most powerful Thaumaturg mages. The Kingdom of the Thaumaturgs was located in the north-west of the continent Jacuruku. The capital city was Anditi Pura, located in the north of the nation,Â while there was a southern capital Isana Pura located in the south. The leaders of the nation were the Circle of Nine, with the Prime Master being Surin.

name: Kokakal Sea
description: The Kokakal Sea was a fierce and cold sea located in the northern part of Seven Cities. It was bordered by the Olphara Peninsula to the west and the Thalas Mountains to the southeast. To the north of the sea lay the Dryjhna Ocean, and to its north east could be found the Sea of Kaltepe Kadesh. The most notable city along its coast was Yath Alban.

name: Kolanse Bay
description: The Forkrul Assail army is deployed to defend the approaches to Kolanse City; their Perish Grey Helm allies will hold the centre of the line. The advancing Bolkando, White Face Barghast and Letherii troops will soon arrive. In Kolanse Bay the Perish Thrones of War are being sunk by squalls, even though there is no wind.

name: Kolanse City
description: Kolanse City was the capital of the country by the same name on the continent of Kolanse. It was located near the Spire.

name: Kor
description: Kor was a city south of the Barrier Range in Korelri, itself named for this city and the city of Elri.

name: Korasch
description: Korasch was a city on the southern coast of the Bluerose Sea on Lether.  To the west was Santchur and to the east was the territory of Drene.

name: Korel
description: Korel was the Malazan name for the continent to the south and east of Quon Tali. The continent was made up to two subcontinents: the Lands of Fist and Stratem.

name: Korelri
description: Korelri was a region on Korel Island, the westernmost island in the archipelago known as "Korel" or the Lands of Fist in the Malazan Book of the Fallen. The Stormwall was built along the Dead Shore to keep the Stormriders from overrunning the land.

name: Korn
description: Korn was a city on the western coast of Quon Tali.  It was northwest of Panys and south of Destry.

name: Korshenn
description: Korshenn was a protectorate of the Letherii Empire situated on the southern coast of the Dracons Sea, west of Pilott. The largest settlement there also bore the name of "Korshenn".

name: Kot Ghul
description: Kot Ghul was a city in the northern portion of the continent of Seven Cities.  It was to the north of the Thalas Mountains near the coast of the Maadil Sea.  To its south was Hatra.

name: Krass
description: Krass was one of the two main cities in Deal on Lether. It was also a port.

name: Kren
description: Kren was a town in the foothills in the interior of Mare, near the borders with Kingdom of Rool and Skolati.

name: Kryn
description: Kryn was a small inland 'nation' located due south of the far southwestern coast of the Bluerose Sea on the continent of Lether. Kryn was officially known as the "Kryn Freetrade Lands" and the Akrynnai claimed sovereignty over it.

name: Kundesh Hills
description: The Kundesh Hills ran from the eastern coast of the Karas Sea to the coast of the Sahul Sea in eastern Seven Cities. The Tapur Road connecting Ahol Tapur and Hissar crossed the hills near the city of Uthor.

name: Kurl
description: Kurl was a city in central Genabackis west of Darujhistan.  It lay south of the Moranth and Mengal Mountains and northwest of the Maiten river and Dwelling Plain.  Kurl maintained a regular army which it used in attempts to tame bandits threatening trade.

name: Kurzan
description: Kurzan was a city on the eastern coast of Bael north of the River Thin's delta. It was either a Nabrajan city or contained a significant Nabrajan population. A trade road ran inland from Kurzan past rolling farmlands to the steppes. Large numbers of ships passed through the city supporting Nabrajan mercantile operations.

name: L'thol Basin
description: The L'thol Basin was located northwest of Aren on Seven Cities.  It was on the northern shore of the Menykh River.

name: Ladormon
description: Ladormon was an ancient tel located just south of Dryj Spring and north of Lod.

name: Laederon Plateau
description: The Laederon Plateau, a tundra, was an isolated height on the northwestern part of the continent of Genabackis. It was home to the war-like Teblor. There was evidence that the blood-oil the Teblor used on their weapons was made from otataral located here.

name: Laeth
description: Laeth was a city in Itko Kan on the western coast of the Nap Sea.  To the southeast was Largen. To the northeast was Pryl.

name: Lake Azur
description: Lake Azur was a large body of water found in the center of Genabackis. The Maiten river, coming off the Dwelling Plain to the south of the lake, fed into it. The northern shore had a pebble beach.

name: Lake Blessing
description: Lake Blessing was located in central Assail west of the Shifting Wastes. A river on the lake's northeast shore fed into the Dread Sea near Exile Keep. Lake Fort stood on its northwestern shore.

name: Lake Blued
description: The Owndos Sea was an inland sea in northwestern Genabackis. There may have been several names in use for this body of water. It is marked as 'L Blued' on the map of Genabackis published in Memories of Ice, probably meaning 'Lake Blued'. It was bounded to the south by the Owndos Range and fed by the Tarthen, Maly and Fool's rivers. On its eastern shore was the city of Owndos, on the north shore, the city of Blued and at the western end, the town of Stopmouth.

name: Lake Fort
description: Lake Fort was one of the largest settlements on Assail according to the map of the continent. It stood on the northwestern shore of Lake Blessing.

name: Lake Seti
description: Lake Seti was a large body of water on the continent of Quon Tali. To the east lay the plain known as Por Seti, and to the west was plain known as Nom Purge.

name: Lallit
description: Lallit was a port city on the western coast of Rool. It was a modest town with a narrow harbour opening onto the Sender's Sea. The tower of the Sea-Gate overlooked the harbour.

name: Lan
description: Lan was a small Letherii village in northwestern Lether.  Nearby were the villages of Brous and Denner.  To the east was the village of Cargo.

name: Larent
description: Larent was a city on the southeastern coast of Quon Tali.  It was located where two great rivers that crossed the continent emptied into the Bloor Sea. To its south was Yellows and to its east was Sentry.  Upriver from Larent was the city of Bloor.

name: Largen
description: Largen was a city in Itko Kan on the western coast of the Nap Sea.  To the southeast was Wal Tes. To the northwest was Laeth.

name: Lato Revae
description: Lato Revae was a small city which lay on the western edge of Raraku and to the northeast of the Thalas Mountains in Seven Cities.  To its north lay the island city of Longshan.

name: Layes
description: Layes was a city in southern Quon Tali.  It was south of Bloor and west of Netor.

name: Lead
description: Lead was a city on the Lead Sea in northern Genabackis.  It lay just downriver from Cat.

name: Lead Sea
description: The Lead Sea was a large inland sea in northern Genabackis roughly the same size as Lake Azur.  Several cities and towns lay on its coast, including Lead and Cruk.  Its southern coast was lined by the Sephal Mountains.  The River Toe exited the sea's northeastern coast and crossed the Stannis Plain to Crest Bay.

name: Lead Steppes
description: The Lead Steppes were located in the northern part of the continent of Genabackis. To their south lay the Bhederin Plateau. To their north lay the Sephal Mountains.

name: Lekester
description: Lekester was an island nation in the Bluerose Sea on the continent of Lether.

name: Lenoh
description: Lenoh was a town on the River P'atha on Seven Cities.  It was located west of the Karas Sea and the Holy City of Karashimesh.  To its east was the town of Setrem, and to its south were Sem'k and Halaf.

name: Lenth
description: Lenth was a city in western Lether on the coast of the Ouster Sea.  To the north was Roster and to the northeast was Gedry.

name: Lesser Laederon Plateau
description: The Lesser Laederon Plateau was a smaller plateau located to the west of the Laederon Plateau in northwestern Genabackis.

name: Lest
description: The city-state of Lest was far to the east of the Free City of Darujhistan and four days' march south of Capustan.   The walled city was known for its raised gardens.  Lest and the nearby city of Setta were producers of fine silks of pale yellow.

name: Lether
description: The continent of Lether (not to be confused with the Empire of Lether) was the setting for the novels Midnight Tides, Reaper's Gale, Dust of Dreams, and The Crippled God. It lay on the other side of the globe from the Malazan Empire. The mapped portion of the continent seen in Midnight Tides extended for over 600 leagues from north to south and for nearly 700 leagues from east to west. The map in Reaper's Gale was significantly larger in scope, but did not have a scale.

name: Lether River
description: The Lether River passed through large portions of the Kingdom of Lether.  Beginning in the mountains surrounding the Bluerose Sea, it passed across the continent through the capital Letheras and on to the Ouster Sea near Gedry. Were river met the sea was known as Lether Mouth.

name: Letheras
description: Letheras [Leh-thair-as] was the capital city of the Kingdom of Lether. the largest and richest city on the Lether continent, and the site of the Imperial Palace. It was the most populous city in the Letherii Empire with over a hundred thousand residents.

name: Li Heng
description: Li Heng was an inland Quon Talian city situated just north of the Dal Hon Plains on the Idryn river.  It straddled the famed Trunk Road trade route connecting Unta in the east to Quon Tali in the west making trade its lifeblood.

name: Listell
description: Listell was a town on the eastern coast of Assail facing the Sea of Hate. It was located on the southern edge of the Talon Forest.

name: Lod
description: Lod was a city along the caravan trail which led through Tithan territory in eastern Seven Cities. One caravan track led to Pit in the west while others led to Gilar Oasis and Sialk in the north.

name: Longshan
description: Longshan was an island city in the northern portion of the continent of Seven Cities.  It lay close to the shore of the Longshan Sea north of Lato Revae and southwest of Pur Atrii.

name: Lookout Mountains
description: The Lookout Mountains were located in northwest Lether north of the Moss River.  They ended in an old range of hills known as Lookout Climb, which had been thoroughly denuded by goats.  Lookout Track steadily climbed into the hills from the town of Siege Place towards Moss Road along the Moss River.

name: Lorest
description: Lorest was a city in northern Skolati on the Korel continent. It was located to the north of the mountains circling the Fist Sea.

name: Lorti
description: Lorti was a city in southern Jasston in the Lands of Fist. It was located on the coast of the Blight Sea near the border of the Plains of Blight.

name: Losten
description: Losten was a town in central Malaz Island located on the northern edge of the Jallid Plain and south of the Broland Hills.  It lay along the road leading between Broland Meet and Pyre.

name: Lothal
description: Lothal was a city on the northern coast of the Seven Cities sub-continent. It was a port on the Kokakal Sea, northwest of the city of Y'Ghatan.  The city was ruled by a Holy Falah'd.

name: Maadil Sea
description: The Maadil Sea was found on the northern part of the continent of Seven Cities. The mainland itself stretched from the sea's most northwestern reaches to the southeast. Various inhabited islands also lined its northern edge.

name: Malaz Bay
description: Malaz Bay was located on the eastern coast of Malaz Island and formed the harbour in Malaz City.

name: Malaz City
description: Malaz City was an island city and the home of Kellanved, the birthplace of his Malazan Empire. The city was located on the small Malaz Island which was found southeast of Quon Tali.  It was split into northern and southern halves by the confluence of the North and South Malaz Rivers which flowed from the Firstsight Mountains into Malaz Bay.

name: Malaz Island
description: Malaz Island, also known as Jakatakan or Malaz Isle, was an island to the southeast of Quon Tali and the northwest of Korel.  There were two cities on the Island, Malaz City and Jakata, as well as several smaller towns and settlements.

name: Malaz River
description: The North and South Malaz Rivers were long east-west rivers that travelled roughly in parallel across northern Malaz Island.  Both rivers had their source in the Firstsight Mountains and crossed the Flint Plain before joining at Malaz City.  The combined river split again into a main and lesser channel near Raven Hill Park and emptied into Malaz Bay at two locations.

name: Mald
description: Mald was a city on the northeastern coast of Mare, near the Skolati border.

name: Maly River
description: The Maly River ran from the mountains surrounding the Lesser Laederon Plateau in northwestern Genabackis southwards to the Owndos Sea. Along the way, it passed through Ninsano Moat and was joined by the Culvern River.  it was one of four rivers which fed into the Owndos Sea.

name: Malybridge
description: Malybridge was a town in northwestern Genabackis. It was located south of the Lesser Laederon Plateau. The West Fool's River passed the city on its way southward to Marktown.  It was similar in size to Ninsano Moat,  and was seventeen days' journey by slow moving cart to Tanys on the coast of the Malyn Sea.

name: Malyn Sea
description: The Malyn Sea was an inland sea in northwestern Genabackis. From there, the Meningalle Ocean was reachable by the Treller Cut to the north or via the city of Genabaris to the south. On its shores lay villages and cities of Malyntaeas, Rope Pull Crossing, North Nape, Upper Malyn, Orbis, Tanys, and Buck.

name: Malyntaeas
description: The city of Malyntaeas was situated on the western shore of the Malyn Sea in northwest Genabackis. The journey to Malyntaeas from Tanys took four days and three nights across the Malyn Sea.

name: Manot
description: Manot was a town to the east of the Karas Sea on Seven Cities.  It was southeast of Caron Tepasi and east of Solbha.  To the northeast was Bakra.

name: Mantle
description: Mantle was a rustic settlement on the northern coast of the Sea of Gold in Assail.  It was situated on a broad bay bordered by tall cliffs that ran along the coast.  The town itself was a collection of huts and shacks.

name: Mantos
description: Mantos was a town located in northwestern Genabackis between Rope Pull Crossing and Pushback.

name: March
description: March was a city on the southern coast of Genabackis.  It was part of the Confederacy of Free Cities and located to the west of Hurly.  It was also near to where Moon's Spawn had crashed into the Rivan Sea.

name: Mare
description: Mare was a nation on the eastern coast of the Island of Fist, sandwiched between the Black Water Strait and the Bloodmare Ocean. It shared borders with the kingdoms of Rool and Skolati.

name: Marktown
description: Marktown was a town on the West Fool's river in northwestern Genabackis.

name: Marl
description: Marl was a city on the eastern coast of the Nap Sea in southern Quon Tali.  It lay downriver and to the south of Bris.  Further southeast on the coast was the city of Vor.

name: Maurik
description: The port city of Maurik was due north of Coral where the River Maurik entered the Rust Ocean. Its main thoroughfare ran west through town from the city harbour.  The southern side of the street was occupied by squat, sprawling multi-story warehouses while the north side was occupied by civic buildings, trader shops, inns, and taverns.   Hauling ropes from the upper floors of the warehouses crossed above the road to the flat roofs of the trader shops.

name: Maurik (river)
description: The River Maurik travelled southeast from the Vision Mountains near Setta to the city of Maurik on the coast of the Rust Ocean.

name: Mawkesh
description: Mawkesh was one of the towns in Truce on the continent of Lether. It was located on the Mawkesh Strait, south of the city of Truce.

name: Melm
description: Melm was a city located where Old Halaf Road crossed the River P'atha to the north of Asmar in Seven Cities.

name: Memories of Ice
description: Memories of Ice is the third book in Steven Erikson's series The Malazan Book of the Fallen. It was released in the UK and Canada in January 2001 and in the US in November 2005.

name: Mengal
description: Mengal was a city on the western coast of Genabackis.  It was located north of the Mengal Mountains and to the west of the Moranth Mountains.

name: Menningalle Ocean
description: Menningale Ocean was located to the West of the continent of Genabackis.

name: Menykh
description: Menykh was a town north of the Menykh River on Seven Cities.  It was located northwest of Aren and south of Balahn.

name: Menykh River
description: The Menykh River ran from the Clatar Sea at Sarsa to the Aren Bay at Aren. At its vast mouth, its waters were a turgid brown extending half a league into the bay.

name: Mersin
description: Mersin was a city on Seven Cities. Once known as Inath'an Merusin, it was the only settlement remaining of the great cities that once lined the Mersin River.

name: Middle
description: Middle was a town located in northwestern Genabackis south of Genabaris and the Grinning Face Range.  It lay on the coast of the Menningale Ocean between Notch and Sidewind.

name: Midnight Tides
description: Midnight Tides is the fifth book in the Malazan Book of the Fallen. It was first published in the UK and Canada in March 2004 and in the US in April 2007.

name: Miner Sluice
description: Miner Sluice was a city in the western region of the Letherii Empire.  It was located on the Brous River, which led to the Domain Ocean.  Downriver was the city of Bridle and upriver was the village of Brous.

name: Mist
description: Mist was a sorceress who lived in Mist Keep on the northern shore of the Dread Sea in Assail. Her powers drew on the Jaghut warren of Omtose Phellack to generate effects of fog and cold. Visitors to her keep were usually enslaved and forced to live in the huts built from wrecked ships that surrounded the keep. Mostly men and mostly foreign, her subjects raised crops to support the town on nearby fields.

name: Mistral Plateau
description: The Mistral Plateau lay near the western coast of Genabackis south of Oach.  It was surrounded on three sides by the mountains of the Moranth Forest.

name: Molz
description: Molz was a city on the northeastern coast of Katakan on the Korel continent. Across the border with Theft to the east was the city of Danig.

name: Monger
description: Monger was a town in the center of Malaz Island at the northern end of the Deland Valley.  It was located just south of the South Malaz River.  A southern road forked eastwards to Grain and westwards to Thal.

name: Monkan
description: Monkan was an island city in the Dryjhna Ocean in northwestern Seven Cities.  To its west was the island nation of Sepik and to the south was the Sepik Sea.

name: Moon Bay
description: Moon Bay was located on the eastern shore of Dracons north of Peaks Bay.  It opened onto the Dracons Sea.

name: Moranth Forest
description: Moranth Forest was a forest in name only. It was actually a mountain range located on western Genabackis. It was home to the Moranth and their preferred beasts of burden, the quorl.

name: Moranth Mountains
description: A mountain range found west and south of the city of Pale.  The Moranth Mountains encircled Cloud Forest.

name: Morass
description: Morass was a town in northwest Genabackis between Buck and Marktown.  It was bordered by Burnout Wood in the north and by Oxfoot Wood in the south.  Beyond a range of hills southeast of the town was Eastern's Wood.

name: Morn
description: Morn was a ruined, haunted place on the southwestern coast of Genabackis, north of Seguleh Island and 200 leagues south of Darujhistan. It was the location of The Rent, a torn Warren. Nearby were K'Chain Che'Malle tombs and a ruined Jaghut tower.  A central barrow buried under the T'ol Ara'd used to hold captive a living matron whose soul had been used to seal the torn Warren long before the time of the Imass.

name: Moss River
description: Moss River was located in northwestern Lether.  It ran from the mountains north of Fort Shake westward to empty into the Katter Bight at Dresh. Moss Road ran along at least part of its length near the hills of Lookout Climb.

name: Mott
description: Mott was a city located in northwestern Genabackis, about 15 leagues inland from the Malaz colony of Prospect.

name: Mott East Wood
description: Located in the northwest of the continent of Genabackis, Mott Wood was the home of the Mott Irregulars and the site of the Mott Campaign which saw the Malazan forces humiliated by the seriously underestimated locals.

name: Mott South Wood
description: Located in the northwest of the continent of Genabackis, Mott Wood was the home of the Mott Irregulars and the site of the Mott Campaign which saw the Malazan forces humiliated by the seriously underestimated locals.

name: Mott West Wood
description: Located in the northwest of the continent of Genabackis, Mott Wood was the home of the Mott Irregulars and the site of the Mott Campaign which saw the Malazan forces humiliated by the seriously underestimated locals.

name: Mrkmon
description: Mrkmon was an ancient tel located to the south of the Karas Sea in the foothills of the Caron Mountains.

name: N'shad
description: N'shad was a town at the northeastern end of the Clatar Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent.

name: N'trmon
description: N'Trmon was an ancient tel just northeast of the city of Sialk along  the coast of the Sahul Sea.

name: Nabrajans
description: The Nabrajans were a people who lived on the plains of the eastern coast of Bael. Unlike the tribes of the neighboring steppes, the Nabrajans had an economy based in extensive agricultural and mercantile concerns. Trade was advanced enough to support mercantile houses, trade roads, and possibly at least one urban center at Kurzan on the coast. Whether by their own manufacture or through trade, they had access to weapons, armour, treated hides, gold ingots, and pack animals. The Nabrajans also engaged in slavery.

name: Nadir
description: Nadir was a city on the Seti Plains of Quon Tali.  It was northeast of Bastial, south of Seti, and southeast of Cullis.

name: Nahal
description: Nahal was a city nestled between the Jhag Odhan and the Jhena Mountains on the north shore of the Clatar Sea in Seven Cities.  The River Ugarat passed the city before emptying into the sea.

name: Nap
description: Nap was a city on the Napan Isles. Its native inhabitants were humans described as having dusky blue skin.

name: Nap Isles
description: The Napan Isles were located between the Quon Tali mainland and Malaz Island, in the Nap Sea. The people of the Napan Isles were distinguished by their dusky blue skin.

name: Nap Sea
description: The Nap Sea lay between the Nap Isles and the eastern Quon Tali mainland. Some maps referred to this sea as the "Cawn Sea".

name: Napan Isles
description: The Napan Isles were located between the Quon Tali mainland and Malaz Island, in the Nap Sea. The people of the Napan Isles were distinguished by their dusky blue skin.

name: Nape Bay
description: Nape Bay was located at the northern end of the Malyn Sea in northwestern Genabackis.

name: Narrows
description: The Narrows, as its name implied, was a relatively thin waterway between Korel Island and Remnant Isle on the Lands of Fist. It connected Crack Strait in the south with the open Sender's Sea to the north.

name: Narthi
description: Narthi was one of several cities located near the N'Trmon tel in eastern Seven Cities. It lay on the coast of the Sahul Sea between the cities of Hissar and Sialk.  To the northwest was Eb and to the southwest was Nitral.

name: Nathilog
description: Nathilog was a city on an island in the north-west of Genabackis. It was amongst the first of the northern Genabackis settlements to be conquered by the Malazan Empire. Some Malaz 2nd Army soldiers involved in the Siege of Pale were veterans of the campaign there.

name: Nenoth Odhan
description: The Nenoth Odhan was a great plain on the continent of Seven Cities. It lay south of the Khundryl Odhan, between Vathar Forest, the Bylan'sh Hills and the Saniphir Hills. To west was the home of the Khundryl tribes and to the east, the Bhilard.

name: Netor
description: Netor was a minor city on the Bloorian plains of southern Quon Tali.  It was southeast of Bloor, to the east of Layes, and to the northwest of Satar.

name: Nevasa
description: Nevasa was a city on the coast of the Maadil Sea in the northern portion of the continent of Seven Cities.  It was southwest of Noh and northeast of Enjo Estarb.

name: New Fort
description: New Fort was located in southeast Dourkan, on the border with the Empire of Jourilan just off Bleeder's Cut.

name: New Landing
description: New Landing was the principle settlement of Galatan Island, which lay of the southern coast off Genabackis in the Galatan Sweep.  The city was on the western coast of the island and was likely a member of the Confederacy of Free Cities.  On the opposite end of the island was Four Towers Ruins.

name: New Seti
description: New Seti was a trading outpost located roughly halfway between Lake Seti and Ero Lake in Por Seti.  The Brittlewash passed the settlement on its way across the plains.

name: Nex
description: Nex was a city in southern Quon Tali northeast of Forest Horn and Fedal. To the southeast were Laeth and Ryns.  To the northeast was Ijor.

name: Nhelth
description: The town of Nhelth was located on the coast of Bylah Bay on Seven Cities. Bylan lay to the south and the southernmost edge of Vathar Forest to the north.

name: Night of Knives
description: Night of Knives is the first novel by Canadian author Ian Cameron Esslemont. It is set in the world of the Malazan Book of the Fallen, a ten-volume epic fantasy series by Esslemont's friend and colleague Steven Erikson. Esslemont and Erikson co-created the Malazan world in the 1980s.

name: Night Ship Islands
description: The Night Ship Islands were among the fluke islands at the tip of southern Genabackis' tail.  Two of the larger islands were Wreck Isle and Corpse Isle.

name: Ninsano Moat
description: Ninsano Moat was a town in northwestern Genabackis that straddled the Maly River south of the Laederon Plateau. It was approximately the same size as Malybridge to its west and larger than Culvern to its east.

name: Nita
description: Nita was a city in northeastern Quon Tali. To its north was Balstro and to its south was Unta, the capital of the Malazan Empire.

name: Nitral
description: Nitral was one of several cities located near the N'Trmon tel in eastern Seven Cities. It lay near the coast of the Sahul Sea north of Sialk.  To the northeast were Narthi and Eb.

name: Noh
description: Noh was a city on the coast of the Maadil Sea in the northern portion of the continent of Seven Cities.  It was northeast of Nevasa.

name: Nohl
description: Nohl was a city on the coast of the Dojal Hading Sea near the mouth of the River P'atha in Seven Cities. It was across the bay from Asmar to the southeast and Devral to the northeast.  The Holy City of Ubaryd lay to the west.

name: Nom Purge
description: Nom Purge was located on the west coast of the continent of Quon Tali. To the northeast and northwest it was bordered by the Forest Fenn with a gap between leading to the Great Fenn Range beyond it. The Horn Ocean was to the west,  Por Seti to the east, and the Dal Hon Plains to the south.

name: North
description: North was a town on the eastern coast of the Dread Sea on Assail. This placed it on the Bone Peninsula where it stood at the foot of the Bone Range.

name: North Citadel
description: North Citadel was a stronghold in the north of Kolanse. It was also referred to as North Keep by the Forkrul Assail. It had a square tower with a rooftop platform, a main gate and battlements with eroded merlons, and was situated in/above a valley. There were caves in its vicinity. The Ses Mountains were to the north.

name: North Horsehead Lake
description: North Horsehead Lake was located in northwestern Genabackis, on the western end of the Owndos Range, east of the town of Bettrys. To the southeast lay the smaller South Horsehead Lake.

name: North March
description: North March was a city in southern Genabackis. Roads leaving the city traveled south to March, southeast to Elingarth, and north to Outlook in central Genabackis.

name: North Nape
description: North Nape was a city on the western shore of the Malyn Sea where it connected with the Treller Cut.

name: Northwind Tundra
description: The Northwind Tundra lined the northern coast of the Genabackis continent facing the Hudd Sea.

name: Notch
description: Notch was a city located in northwestern Genabackis south of Genabaris and the Grinning Face Range.  It lay on the coast of the Menningale Ocean.  Further south on the coast was the town of Middle.

name: Nure
description: Nure was a city on the southern coast of Quon Tali facing the Bloor Sea. To its southwest was Aythan and to its northeast was Gast.

name: Nuth Basin
description: The Nuth Basin was situated southwest of Hissar on Seven Cities. To the southwest was the Vin'til Basin.

name: Oach
description: Oach was a city on the coast of the Menningale Ocean in western Genabackis.  It lay north of the Mistral Plateau and had been conquered by the Malazan Empire some time before 1160 BS.

name: Obertull
description: Obertull was one of the cities in Truce on the continent of Lether. It was located on the shore of Gress Bay, in the Dracons Sea.

name: Ocean of Storms
description: The Ocean of Storms, also called The Cut or the Sea of Storms by the Malazans, was located southeast of Quon Tali, west of Korel, and northeast of Jacuruku. It was also home to the Stormriders.

name: Ohval
description: Ohval was a city on the southern shore of the Karas Sea, just east of Guran in Seven Cities.

name: Old Gedure
description: Old Gedure was a city on the western coast of Lether facing the Domain Ocean.  It was north of Sadon and west of Roster. Nearby was the city of Height.

name: Old Katter
description: Old Katter, or Katter, was a walled city on the northwestern frontier of the Letherii Empire thirty leagues south of Trate. It was located on the southern shore of the Katter River where it formed a delta into the Katter Bight. The city's tall, thin towers seemed to lean seaward.

name: Old King Plateau
description: The Old King Plateau was in northern Genabackis.  It lay to the north of the inland Lead Sea and to the south of the One Eye Mountains.

name: Old Lookout Island
description: Old Lookout Island was located in Malaz Bay amongst the reefs that made sea travel to Malaz City difficult.  It marked the outer edge of the city's harbour and was easily viewable from atop the battlements at Mock's Hold.

name: Old Ruse
description: Old Ruse was a town on Assail, situated on the northern shore at the southern end of a narrow channel called the Fear Narrows which connected the Bay of Timber with the Dread Sea.

name: Olen Brae
description: Olen Brae was an island in the Otataral Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent. It may have been one of several islands known collectively as the Skara Isles.

name: Olived
description: Olived was a city on the southern coast of the Bluerose Sea on Lether.  To the west was Wend and to the north was Santchur.

name: Olonetz Brae
description: Olonetz Brae was an island in the Otataral Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent. It may have been one of several islands known collectively as the Skara Isles.

name: Olphara Forest
description: Olphara Forest lay on the western portion of the continent of Seven Cities. To its west was the Sepik Sea, to its south was the Jhag Odhan, to its northeast was Yath Alban, and to its north lay the Olphara Mountains.

name: Olphara Mountains
description: The Olphara Mountains were a mountain range on the Olphara Peninsula in the northwest of the Seven Cities continent. To the north was the Dryjhna Ocean, to the west the Sepik Sea, to the south the Olphara Forest, to the southeast the Ugarat Odhan, and to the east the Kokakal Sea. The most notable city in the Olphara Mountains was the holy city of Yath Alban.

name: Omari
description: Omari was an ancient city along the Vathar river north of the Vathar Forest and south of the Ugarat Odhan in Seven Cities.

name: One Eye Cat
description: One Eye Cat was one of the former Free Cities on the continent of Genabackis. It was located inland, east of Yend and north of the One Eye Mountains.

name: One Eye Range
description: The One Eye Mountains or the One Eye Range, extended from just south of Yend eastward toward the Stannis Plain in northeastern Genabackis. It marked the northern edge of the Old King Plateau. The River Tears originated in the mountains before heading north to join the River Sogen.

name: Oraz
description: Oraz was a city located in northwestern Genabackis. It lay to the west of Mott along the river leading from Greydog Lake to Prospect Bay.  Mott and Oraz were separated by the Mott West Wood and Oraz Wood.

name: Oraz Wood
description: Oraz Wood was a forest in northwestern Genabackis. It lay on the southern bank of the river connecting the cities of Oraz and Mott. Across the river from the Wood was Mott West Wood.

name: Orb Sceptre Throne
description: Orb Sceptre Throne is the fourth novel by Canadian author Ian Cameron Esslemont. It is set in the world of the Malazan Book of the Fallen, a ten-volume epic fantasy series by Esslemont's friend and colleague Steven Erikson. Esslemont and Erikson co-created the Malazan world in the 1980s.

name: Orbis
description: Orbis was a town just north of Tanys along the shore of the Malyn Sea in northwestern Genabackis.

name: Ostann
description: Ostann was a city in northern Genabackis. It lay between Owndos to the northwest and Cajale to the northeast.

name: Otataral Desert
description: The Otataral Desert covered most of Otataral Island off the east coast of the Seven Cities continent. It was so named for the abundant supply of otataral found there.

name: Otataral Sea
description: The Otataral Sea was found in the northeast part of the Seven Cities continent.  It, or a portion of it, also appeared to be known as the Kansu Sea as that was what Fiddler and Kalam Mekhar called the area between the Skara Isles and Ehrlitan.

name: Ouster
description: Ouster was a city situated south of the far southwestern coast of the Bluerose Sea on the continent of Lether. Ouster was located on the other side of the Bluerose Mountain Range to the north of the land of Kryn. Due north of Ouster was the city, Stall.

name: Ouster Sea
description: The Ouster Sea was essentially a large bay in western Lether.  It was fed by the Lether River and opened onto the Domain Ocean.  Its shores were lined with the cities of Gedry, Lenth, Roster, and Sadon.

name: Outbound
description: Outbound was a city in Bluerose on the northern coast of the Bluerose Sea.  To the southwest was Jasp.

name: Outlook
description: Outlook was the towering mountain fortress of the Pannion Seer in the southern-most area of the Pannion Domin lands in Genabackis. It lay with its back to the southern coast of Pilgrim Lake across the River Heath from the city of Heath. A road connected Outlook to North March and Elingarth in the southern portion of the continent. To the city's east was a large village named Kaimerlor.

name: Owndos
description: Owndos was a city in northwestern Genabackis on the eastern shore of the Owndos Sea, at the eastern end of the mountain range.

name: Owndos Range
description: The Owndos Range ran from just east of the Owndos Sea in northwestern Genabackis. The range ran along the southern shore of the sea and west towards the city of Bettrys.

name: Owndos Sea
description: The Owndos Sea was an inland sea in northwestern Genabackis. There may have been several names in use for this body of water. It is marked as 'L Blued' on the map of Genabackis published in Memories of Ice, probably meaning 'Lake Blued'. It was bounded to the south by the Owndos Range and fed by the Tarthen, Maly and Fool's rivers. On its eastern shore was the city of Owndos, on the north shore, the city of Blued and at the western end, the town of Stopmouth.

name: Oxfoot Wood
description: Oxfoot Wood was located south of the town Morass in northwestern Genabackis.

name: P'atha
description: The River P'atha ran from the Path'apur Mountains to the Dojal Hading Sea at Asmar in Seven Cities. Along the river were the cities of Halaf, Devral, and Melm.

name: Palat Forest
description: Palat Forest was located on the eastern coast of the continent of Genabackis, south of Capustan and Coral.

name: Pale
description: Pale was one of the Free Cities on the continent of Genabackis. According to Ganoes Paran, it was about a thousand leagues from Genabaris although this may have been a figure of speech. Tattersail estimated Pale to be about three thousand leagues from Unta.

name: Paliss
description: Paliss was a large inland city and the capital of the Kingdom of Rool. It was there at the city's fortress that "Overlord" Yeull 'ul Taith installed himself.

name: Pan'potsun
description: Pan'potsun was one of the Holy Cities of Seven Cities. It was situated on the northeastern coast of the subcontinent.

name: Pan'Potsun Odhan
description: The Pan'potsun Odhan, or waste, was an area west of the holy city of Karashimesh, east of Raraku and north of the Ubaryd Odhan, on the sub-continent of Seven Cities.

name: Panys
description: Panys was a city near the western coast of Quon Tali.  It was southwest of Attic, southeast of Korn, and north of Arath.

name: Patch
description: PatchÂ wasÂ a city situated on the continent ofÂ Genabackis. It was at the northern end of the Rhivi TrailÂ which led down to Pale.  It lay on the southern shore of a lake across from the city of Bear.

name: Path'apur Mountains
description: The Path'apur mountains were found on the northeast section of the Seven Cities continent. To their north was A'rath Forest, to the northwest was the holy city of Ehrlitan, to their west was the Ehrlitan Sea, to their south was the Sialk Odhan, and to the east was the Otataral Sea.

name: Peaks Bay
description: Peaks Bay was located on the eastern shore of Dracons south of Moon Bay.  It opened onto the Dracons Sea.

name: Pearls
description: Pearls was a city on the southwestern coast of the Bluerose Sea on Lether.  To the north was Bluerose and to the east was Stall.

name: Peck
description: Peck was one of the larger cities in the nation of Isthmus on the continent of Lether.

name: Pelasiar Sea
description: The Pelasiar Sea was a large bay or sea in southeastern Lether south of Kolanse. Its northern shore was the site of at least three ruined settlements of unknown size.

name: Penalh
description: Penalh was a town located north of the Clatar Sea on Seven Cities. It was one of several towns on a river that ran southwards to Geleen and the sea. To the north was the town of Tenumb. To the south was Ehnal.

name: People of the Wind
description: The People of the Wind, also known as the Yaguran or Sons of the Wind, were tribal humans who lived on the steppes of Bael where they competed for land with their neighbors, the Nabrajans.

name: Pilgrim Camp
description: The Pilgrim camp was located outside of Black Coral next to the Great Barrow.

name: Pilgrim Lake
description: Pilgrim Lake was a large body of water within the territory of the Pannion Domin. It was fed by the River Heath which entered the lake from the south between the city of Outlook and the town of Heath. The River Stem exited the lake's northern coast and emptied into Coral Bay.

name: Pillar
description: Pillar was a town on the Wreckers' Coast of eastern Assail. The town of Widden was to its east and the town of Burnt was to its south.

name: Pilott
description: Pilott was a protectorate of the Letherii Empire situated on the southern coast of the Dracons Sea, east of Korshenn.

name: Pirate's Sea
description: The Pirate's Sea was an inland sea between Theft and Fist Island in the Lands of Fist. It was part of a larger body of water which included the Sender's Sea and The Curl.

name: Pit
description: Pit was a city along several caravan trails north of the Caron Mountains in eastern Seven Cities. One caravan track led east to Lod while others led north to Manot and northwest to the River Sekala.

name: Plain of Chance
description: The Plain of Chance was located in northeastern Assail. It extended into the Bay of Timber and the Sea of Hate. The town of Press was located on its southwestern border.

name: Plain of Ghosts
description: The Plain of Ghosts was located in northwestern Assail along the coast of Reacher's Ocean. The name was synonymous to outsiders with the Barren Coast.

name: Plain of Lamatath
description: The Lamatath Plain, or Plain of Lamatath, was a vast grassland which stretched nearly from coast to coast in southern Genabackis to the south of Darujhistan. To the south of it lay the cities of Callows and Trygalle.

name: Plain of Longing
description: The Plain of Longing was located in northeastern Assail between the Dreaming Range and the northern reaches of the Bone Range. To the east it was bounded by the Sea of Hate.

name: Plain of Sighs
description: The Plain of Sighs was located in northeastern Assail where it ran along the Wrack Coast of the Sea of Hate. It was bounded to the southeast by the Dreaming Range and to the west by the Plain of Visions and the Blood Range.

name: Plain of Visions
description: The Plain of Visions was located on the northern coast of Assail. It was bounded by the Plain of Sighs to the east and by the Blood Range to the south. The town of Fallen was located on its western edge.

name: Plains of Blight
description: The Plains of Blight were situated between the Blight Sea to the southwest, and The Curl to the north. To the west was Jasston and south of the plains lay the Iceback Range.

name: Pon-Ruo
description: Pon-Ruo was a town located in the southwestern part of the Empire of Jourilan, east of Golk and northeast of Antr.

name: Poon
description: Poon was a city located east of the Blood Isthmus in Katakan.

name: Por Seti
description: Por Seti was the name given a section of land in the northern part of the continent of Quon Tali. To its north was Forest Fenn, to its west was Nom Purge, to its south lay the Dal Hon Plains, and to its east was Ero Lake. Lake Seti was on its western edge. Por Seti was home to the Seti people.

name: Press
description: The town of Press was located in northeastern Assail on the southwestern edge of the Plain of Chance. Downriver to its south was the town of Holly and the Bay of Timber.

name: Prospect
description: Prospect was a Malaz colonial city roughly halfway between Genabaris to the north and Nathilog to the south on the northwestern coast of Genabackis.

name: Prospect Bay
description: Prospect Bay lay on the northwest coast of Genabackis and opened onto the Menningale Ocean.  It was the location of the Malazan colonial city of Prospect.  The river that fed into the bay originated in the Owndos Range before passing through Greydog Lake.  The city of Mott was about 15 leagues upriver from the bay.

name: Protector Isle
description: Protector Isle was a small island mostly covered by mountains between the Tower Sea and the Curl.

name: Pryl
description: Pryl was a city in Itko Kan on the western coast of the Nap Sea.  To the east was Itko Kan.  To the southwest was Laeth.

name: Pult
description: The town of Pult was located south of Bylah Bay on Seven Cities.  The road through Pult led north to Tarxian and Thuryx and south to Therypand.

name: Pur Atrii
description: Pur Atrii was a city in the northern portion of the continent of Seven Cities.  It was to the north of Raraku and to the west of Kansu.

name: Purage
description: Purage was a city on the western coast of Quon Tali in Nom Purge.  It was north of the cities of Quon Tali and Dass.

name: Pushback
description: Pushback was a town located in northwestern Genabackis between Stick-in-Hole and Mantos. It was north of Genabaris.

name: Pyre
description: Pyre was a town on Malaz Island located along the road between Losten and Three Roads.  The Pyre River passed through the town before heading southward deeper into the Taral and South Plains.

name: Pyre River
description: The Pyre River crossed Malaz Island from the central Broland Hills and Ricker Mountains to the island's southeastern coast with the Strait of Storms.  The river passed through the town of Pyre before crossing the Taral and South Plains.

name: Quon Tali
description: Quon Tali was the home continent of the Malazan Empire. It was bounded to the south and west by the Horn Ocean. To the southeast lay Reacher's Ocean and to the east, the Falari and Bloor Seas. In the north lay the Ice Fields and to the northeast, the Colonnus Sea.

name: Quon Tali (city)
description: Quon Tali was a city and province on the western coast of the continent of the same name, Quon Tali.  The city was formed of two neighbouring sister cities originally known as Quon and Tali. The city lay on the western terminus of the ancient Trunk Road trade route which crossed the continuent to Li Heng and Unta.  Tali was a "sprawling collection of distinct precincts and quarters".

name: Rahl
description: The town of Rahl was located on the coast of Bylah Bay on Seven Cities. Gresh lay to the north and Tarxian to the south.

name: Rance
description: Rance was one of the towns in Truce on the continent of Lether. It was located on the shore of Gress Bay, in the Dracons Sea.

name: Rang
description: Rang was the outermost city on the long Maadil Peninsula dividing the Kokakal Sea and the Maadil Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent. Across the water to the east was the island city of Kaliban. To Rang's south lay Taxila.

name: Range of the Saints
description: The Range of the Saints was a chain of mountains in western Assail. They ran in a north-south direction. To their northeast were the Vanishing Wastes. Tribes of nomads lived between the western side of the mountains and Reacher's Ocean.

name: Raraku
description: Raraku [Rare-uh-koo], also known as the Holy Desert, was a region west of the Pan'potsun Odhan on Seven Cities. It lay in the northwest of the subcontinent between the cities of Ehrlitan and Karashimesh.

name: Rath
description: Rath was a city in central Quon Tali located on a river which crossed the continent from Forest Fenn to the Bloor Sea. To its southeast was Thade and to its northeast was Thades.

name: Rathar
description: Rathar was a city located on the River Tep near the base of the Caron Mountains on Seven Cities.  It lay at the beginning of a caravan trail that led to Keff.  Downriver from the city was Teppes.

name: Raven
description: Raven, or Raven Town, was a shantytown just outside the southern wall of Darujhistan at Raven Gate.  It lay at the intersection of Ridge Road leading west to Ridge and Hinter Road leading east to Urs.  A trader road led southwards through the Raven Hills to the Dwelling Plain.

name: Reach
description: Reach was a town on the western coast of the Sea of Gold on Assail near the Blood Range. It was located south of Mantle.

name: Reach Inlet
description: Reach Inlet was an extension of the Calash Sea into northwestern Lether near the Reach penninsula.  The black, depthless water smelled of ice and was bordered by jagged mountains and snow-clad peaks.

name: Reacher's Ocean
description: Reacher's Ocean bordered the southeast coast of the continent of Quon Tali, and the continent of Korel. Malaz Island was located there as well.

name: Reaper's Gale
description: Reaper's Gale is the seventh novel the Malazan Book of the Fallen epic fantasy series. It was published in the UK May 7, 2007, in Canada June 5, 2007, and in the US on March 4, 2008.

name: Redhouse
description: Redhouse was a town in northwestern Genabackis located just south of the Central Malyn Range.  A river originating in the mountains passed through the town on its way south to Buck Swamp.

name: Redstick Forest
description: Redstick Forest was a large forest on the northwest coast of Genabackis between the Toblai Tundra and the West Malyn Range.  To the west it faced the Menningale Ocean.

name: Reef Strait
description: The Reef Strait was a channel which connected the Dracons Sea with the Domain Ocean.

name: Refuge
description: Refuge was a city on the coast of south Genabackis. It was a member of the Confederacy of Free Cities.  To its west was Golden.

name: Remnant Isle
description: Remnant Isle was a large island south of the Crack Strait from Korel Island. It was separated from Dourkan by Bleeder's Cut and from Jasston by the Flow Strait. To the east, across the Tower Sea, was Protector Isle and to the northeast was Fall Strait.

name: Rennis
description: Rennis was a port town on the western coast of Lether facing the Domain Ocean.  It was part of the Letherii Empire.  Boaral Keep was thirty leagues to its south.

name: Return of the Crimson Guard
description: Return of the Crimson Guard is the second high fantasy novel by Canadian author Ian C. Esslemont set in the world of the Malazan Book of the Fallen, co-created with Esslemont's friend and colleague Steven Erikson. Chronologically, Return of the Crimson Guard takes place after the events in Erikson's sixth Malazan novel, The Bonehunters. Return of the Crimson Guard is the second novel by Esslemont to take place in the Malazan world, starting with Night of Knives and followed by Stonewielder.

name: Rhegh
description: Rhegh was a town along the Menykh River between Aren and Sarsa. It was surrounded by the Rhegh Forest.

name: Rhegh Forest
description: Rhegh Forest was located along the Menykh River between Sarsa and Aren on Seven Cities.  It surrounded the town of  Rhegh.  The town of Hyryb stood on the forest's northeastern border.

name: Rhivi Plain
description: The Rhivi Plain was a large plain in the center of north Genabackis. To the north of Pale, it was flat and yellow-grassed. The plain was mainly composed of grassland and its centre was home to the nomadic Rhivi culture. The Rhivi Trail ran from the city of Pale north, through the plain to Patch. The Plain was surrounded on three sides (west, east and south) by mountain ranges including the Barghast Range, the Tahlyn Mountains and the Moranth Mountains and forestland.

name: Rhivi Trail
description: The Rhivi Trail on Genabackis stretched from Patch in the north, across the Rhivi Plain, to Pale in the south.

name: Ricker Mountains
description: The Ricker Mountains were part of a chain crossing most of central Malaz Island.  To the west they linked to the Firstsight Mountains and to the south they descended into the Broland Hills.  Tin and copper were mined from the area, and the Broland and Pyre Rivers originated somewhere in their heights.

name: Ridge
description: Ridge, or Ridge Town, was a settlement just outside the southern wall of Darujhistan on the River Foss. Traveling east on Ridge Road led to Raven Town.  Traveling west on Foss Road led to Cuttertown.

name: Ridge Island
description: Ridge Island was a small island in the Dracons Sea at the mouth of the Reef Strait in Dracons.  The larger chain of islands to which it belonged may have been the Draconean Isles.

name: Ring
description: Ring was a large walled city located along the eastern border of the Empire of Jourilan where the Lesser White River flowed into the Flow Strait and the Blight Sea. Its name was probably derived from the Ring Wall which lay almost directly north of the city.

name: Ring Wall
description: The Ring Wall was a ring-shaped island between the Flow Strait and the Blight Sea. The inner lake, The Hole, was surrounded by cliffs ten fathoms high and accessible only through a narrow strait. The strait was protected against Stormriders by a deep metal mesh net which was anchored by a massive chain across the top of the cliffs. The chain's links were as a thick as a person's thigh and it was held in place by cyclopean stones.

name: Rip
description: Rip was a city on the eastern coast of Theft on the Korel continent. It faced the Pirate's Sea.

name: Rivan Sea
description: The Rivan Sea lay off the southern coast of Genabackis, stretching from the Isle of the Seguleh in the west to the Confederacy of Free Cities to the east.

name: Rivdo
description: Rivdo was a port city on the Black Water Strait in the kingdom of Mare on the Island of Fist.

name: River Bakun
description: The Bakun River originated from multiple streams in the Caron Mountains on the eastern part of the Seven Cities continent. Those streams combined and moved southward to Bakun and the Dojal Hading Sea.

name: River Thin
description: The River Thin, or Thin River, ran eastward on Bael from the vicinity of the Spur to the Anari Narrows on the Sea of Hate. Along the way they passed Kurzan.

name: Rock Bay
description: Rock Bay was located on the southern coast of the Malyn Sea in northwestern Genabackis.

name: Rool
description: The Kingdom of Rool was a region on the western coast of the Island of Fist, south of the Sea of Fist. The Trembling Range ran along its northern border. It was the most powerful state on Fist and a rival to Korelri.

name: Root Forest
description: Root Forest was located in southern Genabackis, north of the ruins of Morn.

name: Roster
description: Roster was a city in western Lether on the coast of the Ouster Sea.  To the south was Lenth and to the east was Gedry.

name: Rough Landing
description: Rough Landing was a town on the western shore of the Bay of Timber in Assail. It was part of the Bone Peninsula, and backed onto the Bone Range in the west. It was south of Holly and northwest of Bones.

name: Run
description: Run was a town in eastern Assail. The town of Burnt was to its northeast while Deep Root was to its southeast.

name: Rust Hills
description: The Rust Hills were a chain of hills in southern Malaz Island that ran roughly from the southwest to the northeast.  They were broken into two sections known as the North Rust Hills and the South Rust Hills.  The hills marked the boundary between the Jallid and Taral Plains.  The North Rust Hills were mined for an unspecified type of material.  The South Rust Hills were near the town of Blood.

name: Rust Ocean
description: The Rust Ocean was located to the east of the continent of Genabackis.

name: Rutu Jelba
description: Rutu Jelba was a port city in northern Otataral Island on the Seven Cities subcontinent. It was located on a narrow isthmus between the Otataral and Talgai Seas. Fiddler described it as a lizard-infested, orange-bricked cesspool.

name: Ryns
description: Ryns was a city in Itko Kan.  It lay east of Forest Horn.  To the east was Largen and to the south was Bathi.

name: Sadon
description: Sadon was a city in western Lether on the coast of the Ouster Sea.  To the east was Roster and to the north was Old Gedure.

name: Sahul Sea
description: Sahul Sea was a body of water on the eastern edge of Seven Cities. Specifically, it bordered the Sialk Odhan and Caron Mountains on the mainland and the Otataral Island to the north. Important cities along its coast included Sialk, Hissar and Dosin Pali.

name: Salt Mountains
description: The Salt Mountains of northern Assail were also known as the Salt Peaks, the Salt Range, and the Blood Range.  They were divided into two regions known as the East and West Salt Ranges.  At the centre of the range were the Bare Rock Peaks surrounded by a great Ice Plain.  On their lower slopes were the Greathalls of the Iceblood clans.

name: Salt Range
description: The Salt Mountains of northern Assail were also known as the Salt Peaks, the Salt Range, and the Blood Range.  They were divided into two regions known as the East and West Salt Ranges.  At the centre of the range were the Bare Rock Peaks surrounded by a great Ice Plain.  On their lower slopes were the Greathalls of the Iceblood clans.

name: Saltoan
description: Saltoan was one of the oldest cities on the Vision Plain. It was located in the eastern part of the continent of Genabackis on the trader road between Darujhistan and Capustan. It was surrounded by thick low walls stained with brown streaks. No guards monitored traffic passing through the huge wooden doors of the city's gates.  Having sent its vaunted Horse Guard to join Caladan Brood's Host, the city became a mostly lawless place with its pitiful constabulary no match for the various thieving groups vying to control the city.

name: Saltong's Reach
description: Saltsong's Reach was an area of water between the Domain Ocean and the Calash Sea off the coast of northwestern Lether.

name: Sanimon
description: Sanimon was a tel north of the Geleen Plain, sandwiched between the Saniphir and Bylan'sh Hills. It had once been a thriving city. The Sanith Odhan was immediately to the south.

name: Saniphir Hills
description: The Saniphir Hills were located north of the Geleen Plain and west of Sanimon.

name: Sanith Odhan
description: Sanith Odhan was an area to the south of the tel Sanimon.

name: Santchur
description: Santchur was a city on the southern coast of the Bluerose Sea on Lether.  To the south was Olived and to the east was Korasch.

name: Saphinand Kingdom
description: The Saphinand Kingdom was located in the far east of the continent of Lether, separated from their allies, the Bolkando by the Ak'ryn Corridor to the southwest. Its people were known as the Saphii.

name: Sarn
description: Sarn was a city within the territory of the Pannion Domin. It was located to the west of Pilgrim Lake and to the east of Bastion.

name: Sarpachiya
description: Sarpachiya was a major city on the River Ugarat north of the Clatar Sea on Seven Cities.  The river originated in the Thalas Mountains and ran roughly north-south, passing through Ugarat before reaching Sarpachiya.  Further downriver was T'sarech and Nahal.

name: Sarsa
description: Sarsa was a city located at the extreme eastern end of the south shore of the Clatar Sea, west of Aren in Seven Cities.

name: Satar
description: Satar was a city in southern Quon Tali.  It was southeast of Netor and southwest of Drim.

name: Screaming Range
description:
The Screaming Range were the mountains which covered the southern tip of Korel Island.
It was one of the homes of the indigenous tribal people that had been displaced by the settlers of the Lands of Fist.

name: Sea Iban
description: Sea Iban was located to the south of the continent of Lether. To the north lay the nation of Isthmus, to the west, T'roos, and to the east, Deal and D'aliban.

name: Sea of Gallada
description: The Sea of Galada was located to the northeast of Seven Cities. Specifically, it was found southeast of Bandiko Sea.

name: Sea of Gold
description: The Sea of Gold was a large body of water in northeastern Assail.  It was fed by rivers running from the Salt Mountains and the Dreaming Range.  A channel led from the sea's southern end into the Dread Sea.

name: Sea of Hate
description: The Sea of Hate was located off the eastern coast of Assail. It was joined to the Bay of Timber which extended inland to the west.

name: Sea of Kaltepe Kadesh
description: The Sea of Kaltepe Kadesh was located to the north of Seven Cities. To its west was the Dryjhna Ocean, to its south lay Maadil Sea, on its southeast corner was the Otataral Sea, and to the east was the Bandiko Desert.

name: Second Landing
description: Second Landing was a town on the eastern coast of the Dread Sea on Assail. This placed it on the Bone Peninsula where it stood at the foot of the Bone Range.

name: Second Maiden Fort
description: Second Maiden Fort was one of three fortresses in northwestern Lether which defended the mouth of Katter Bight.  The other two fortresses were First Maiden Fort and Third Maiden Fort. Spyrock Island and Tour's Spit were the nearest points of land lying between it and Second Maiden Fort.

name: Seeker's Deep
description: Seeker's Deep was the Malazan name for the body of water known as the Meningalle Ocean by natives of Genabackis. It lay east of the Seven Cities subcontinent.

name: Seguleh Island
description: Seguleh Island was located directly south of Morn off the southwestern coast of Genabackis. It was home to the Seguleh, a warrior people.

name: Sekal
description: Sekal was a town at the mouth of the Sekala River on the Karas Sea on the Seven Cities continent. Its stone bridge was the only place to cross the river other than the ford at L'enbarl five days upriver.

name: Sem'k
description: The Semk were a Seven Cities tribe centered in the Karas Hills and Steppes who had an avowed hatred of all who were not Semk.  They had a reputation as fierce warriors who kept captive enemies alive so that they could torture them.  During battle, they covered themselves in ash and fought in a wild, undisciplined manner. They were feared by the Tithansi.

name: Sender's Sea
description: The Sender's Sea was an inland sea which was situated between the Kingdoms of Rool and Stygg in the Lands of Fist. It was part of a larger body of water which included the Pirate's Sea and The Curl.

name: Sentry
description: Sentry was a city on the eastern coast of Quon Tali facing the Bloor Sea. To its northeast was Unta, the capital of the Malazan Empire. To its west was Larent.

name: Sephal Mountains
description: The Sephal Mountains were located in northern Genabackis stretching from the coast of the Rust Ocean to the southern shores of the Lead Sea.  They marked the northern boundary of the Lead Steppes and surrounded the city of Taph.

name: Sepik
description: Sepik was a city, island, and kingdom of the same name located in the Sepik Sea northwest of the Seven Cities subcontinent. To the island's north was the Dryjhna Ocean and to its southwest was the nation of Nemil. To the northeast was the island city of Monkan.

name: Sepik Sea
description: The Sepik Sea bordered the northwestern part of the continent of Seven Cities, and the island of Sepik. Specifically, it touched on the Olphara Mountains and Olphara Forest on the mainland itself, and was surrounded by the Dryjhna Ocean on the north and the west.

name: Ses Mountains
description: The Ses Mountains were located in Kolanse running along the northern border of Estobanse Province.  North Citadel, Back, Danan, and Hetok were located to the range's south.

name: Seti (settlement)
description: The settlement of Seti was located in central Por Seti, west of New Seti, not far from Fort Saran.

name: Setrem
description: Setrem was a town on Seven Cities that was located west of the Karas Sea and the Holy City of Karashimesh.  To its west was the town of Lenoh on the River P'atha. To its south were the Karas Hills.

name: Setta
description: The empty city of Setta was located at the northern tip of the Pannion Domin's territory, south-west of Lest, and due east of the Vision Mountains.  It lay on the banks of the Setta River, from which the city took its name, and which flowed to the Rust Ocean near Lest.  The Maurik River also passed close by on its way to the city of the same name.  It was larger in size than Capustan.   Setta was larger than Capustan.

name: Seven Cities
description: Seven Cities was a sub-continent north of Quon Tali and west of Genabackis that had been conquered by the Malazan Empire. It was an ancient land, built upon the ruins of countless cities dating back to the First Empire.  Hot, dry, and largely desert, its sands obscured forgotten pathways, hoarded power, and soaked up sorcery.  Every foot of the land had been walked by Ascendants.

name: Shade
description: Shade was one of the larger cities in Stygg. It was located inland.

name: Shale
description: Shale was one of the larger cities in Stygg. It was located on the west coast, west of the Ebon Mountains.

name: Shand
description: Shand was a half-blooded Tarthenal and one of three 'handsome', brawny, and intimidating women employed by Tehol Beddict of Letheras. Shand was described as sporting a shaved head, and having gleaming pale skin, wide-set light grey eyes, and possessing 'fine' legs (in Tehol's opinion). She was attired in almost white, skin-tight, tanned rawhide. Her comrades and associates were Rissarh and Hejun.

name: Shedry
description: Shedry was a city near the eastern coast of the Nap Sea in southern Quon Tali.  It lay upriver and to the north of Halas.  Further upriver was city of Estawn.

name: Shelter
description: Shelter was a fortress in southeastern Korelri, part of Korel Island. Its walls were flat grey and its stone military pier extended into the Crack Strait.

name: Shenohl Forest
description: Shenohl Forest was located on the north coast of the inland Clatar Sea on Seven Cities.  It nearly surrounded the city of Nahal.  Its eastern border reached the town of Denard.

name: Shifting Wastes
description: The Shifting Wastes were located in central Assail between the Dread Sea and the Black Sea.

name: Shore of Sand
description: The Shore of Sand was the name for the northwestern coast of the Black Sea on Assail. It ran to Black Fingers Forest in the east. To its north were the Shifting Wastes.

name: Shore of Stone
description: The Shore of Stone was the name for the southern coast of the Black Sea on Assail. At its easternmost extent was Towerpoint. At its west, the Black River emptied into the sea. Midway down the length of its shore were the ruins of some unknown structure or settlement.

name: Shroud
description: Shroud was one of the larger cities in Stygg. It was located on the west coast.

name: Sialk
description: Sialk was a port city on the Sahul Sea on the east coast of Seven Cities. It was located twenty leagues south of Hissar.

name: Sialk Odhan
description: The Sialk Odhan was found on the eastern edge of the Seven Cities continent. To its south lay the Caron Mountains, to its east was the Sahul Sea, to its north was the Otataral Sea, to its northwest were the Path'apur Mountains, and to its west was the holy desert Raraku. The holy city of Karashimesh was found within this odhan and the cities of Hissar and Sialk lay on its edge at the coast of the Sahul Sea.

name: Sidewind
description: Sidewind was a town located on the coast of the Menningale Ocean in northwestern Genabackis. It lay up the coast from the Malazan colony Prospect and down the coast from Middle.  To the east were the Sidewind Hills.

name: Sidewind Hills
description: The Sidewind Hills were located in northwestern Genabackis, east of the town of Sidewind and south of the Hole Hills and Water Reach Wood.  To the south was the city of Mott.

name: Silent People
description: The Silent People, also known as the Yag'Quarall, were a nomadic race of mixed human-Jaghut blood on the western plains of Assail. They lived in clans and were fiercely territorial and protective of their resource poor lands. They killed male trespassers and captured children and women of childbearing years.

name: Silver Lake
description: Silver Lake was a Nathii settlement on a lake by the same name east of the Laederon Plateau (home of the Teblor tribes) in Northern Genabackis.

name: Skara Brae
description: Skara Brae was an island in the Otataral Sea on the Seven Cities subcontinent. It was one of several islands known collectively as the Skara Isles. The white-skinned residents, known as Skrae, were involved in fishing and trading.

name: Skolati
description: Skolati was an autonomous region in the northern part of the Island of Fist, north of the Fist Sea.

name: Sky Tower
description: The Sky Tower, sometimes known as Skytower or the Isle of Skytower, was located on a small island in the center of the Tower Sea on Remnant Isle. The most isolated and secure of the Stormguard fortresses, it was garrisoned by four hundred men to protect the order's holiest relic. It was considered the most demanding and important posting achievable within the Chosen.

name: Slow Wood Swamp
description: Slow Wood Swamp was located on Stopmouth Bay where the Fool's river fed into the Owndos Sea in northwestern Genabackis.

name: Sogena
description: Sogena was a former Free City on the River Sogen in northeastern Genabackis.

name: Solbha
description: Solbha was a city on the southern shore of the Karas Sea on Seven Cities. It was located between Sekal and Caron Tepasi.  To the east was Manot.

name: Somon
description: Somon was an ancient tel along the caravan trail which led south from the city of Ohval in Seven Cities.

name: Sorol Forest
description: The Sorol Forest ran along the southern edge of the Owndos Range southwest of the Owndos Sea in northwestern Genabackis.  The forest's northwesternmost region was known as Greydog Wood.

name: Sotka
description: Sotka was a city located in the north of the Seven Cities sub-continent on the shores of the Kokakal Sea. Sotka Fork seemed to be a branch of the Sotka Road coming from Y'Ghatan.

name: South Horsehead Lake
description: South Horsehead Lake was located in northwestern Genabackis, on the western end of the Owndos Range, east of the city of Bettrys. To the northwest lay the larger North Horsehead Lake. To the southeast ran a channel which eventually led to the Owndos Sea.

name: South Jhag Odhan
