description: Olphara Forest lay on the western portion of the continent of Seven Cities. To its west was the Sepik Sea, to its south was the Jhag Odhan, to its northeast was Yath Alban, and to its north lay the Olphara Mountains.

name: South Plain
description: The South Plain covered the southeastern region of Malaz Island.  It was separated from the Taral Plain to the west by the Pyre River.  The towns of Grove, Pyre, and Three Roads lay on its northern edge.  The plain surrounded the Forest Kril on three sides.

name: Spire
description: The Spire (also called Great Spire) was a unique formation of rock that stretched out high above the water on the east coast of Kolanse, on a peninsula just southeast of Kolanse City. The waters around the promontory were red as blood and nothing could live in it. It was said that a star fell from the sky there, long ago. The waters were also described as raging into foaming spume the colour of mare's milk.

name: Stall
description: Stall was a city on the southwestern coast of the Bluerose Sea on Lether.  To the west was Pearls and to the east was Wend.  To the south was Ouster.

name: Stannis Plain
description: The Stannis Plain was located in northeastern Genabackis, southeast of the One Eye Mountains.

name: Steel
description: Steel was a city on the northeastern coast of Theft on the Korel continent. It faced the Pirate's Sea.

name: Stem
description: The River Stem exited the northern coast of Pilgrim Lake on Genabackis. After traveling through the territory of the Pannion Domin, it and emptied into Coral Bay.

name: Stick-in-Hole
description: Stick-in-Hole was a city on the northwestern coast of Genabackis  which was bisected by the Treller Cut.

name: Stonewielder
description: Stonewielder is the third novel by Canadian author Ian Cameron Esslemont. It is set in the world of the Malazan Book of the Fallen, a ten-volume epic fantasy series by Esslemont's friend and colleague Steven Erikson. Esslemont and Erikson co-created the Malazan world in the 1980s.

name: Stop Mouth Bay
description: Stopmouth Bay was located at the western end of the Owndos Sea, adjacent to the town from which it took its name. To the north was Slow Wood Swamp.

name: Stopmouth
description: Stopmouth was a town at the western end of the Owndos Sea, on Stopmouth Bay in northwestern Genabackis. To the north was the Slow Wood Swamp.

name: Storin Cut
description: Storin Cut was a channel on the northern side of Korel Island in the Lands of Fist. Located near the border of Theft and Katakan, it connected Reacher's Ocean to the waters between Korel Island and the smaller islands that lay off its shore. Storin Reef began near the cut before heading off to the northeast.

name: Storin Reef
description: Storin Reef ran for an enormous distance off northern Korel into Reacher's Ocean. Its southernmost extent neared Storin Cut.

name: Storm
description: Storm was the most southwesterly city in Korelri, part of Korel Island.

name: Stormwall
description: The Stormwall was a massive defensive fortification extending over 100 leagues (350 miles) along the Dead Shore, on the northwest coast of Korel Island. The wall was built of colossal fitted stones to protect the continent from attack by the Stormriders, the sorcerer-spirits of the Ocean of Storms, whose attacks were ceaseless and brutal during the winter fighting season.

name: Strait of Storms
description: The Strait of Storms was the portion of the Ocean of Storms separating Malaz Island and Quon Tali from Korel.

name: Strike
description: Strike was the largest city on Strike Island, the easternmost of the Falari Isles. It was located on the south shore of the Island.

name: Strike Island
description: Strike Island was the easternmost and most isolated of the Falari Isles. The largest city on the island was Strike.

name: Strom Sea
description: The Strom Sea was located in the interior of the Falari Isles, between Delanss Island and the Walk Sea and adjacent to the Cragg Sea.

name: Stunra
description: The cities of Stunra and Keff lay at the crossroads of several caravan tracks on Seven Cities.  Trade from Asmar, Guran, Halaf, and Rathar passed through these two locations.

name: Sty
description: Sty was a High Marshal in the Mott Irregulars. He was described as a tall, awkward looking man with a lopsided toothy smile and large bony fists.

name: Stygg
description: Stygg was the area north of the Ebon Mountains on the southeastern shore of the Sender's Sea. To the northeast was the Black Water Strait. Beyond the Ebon Mountains lay the Deep Wilderness.

name: T'ev
description: The town of T'ev on Seven Cities was located on the road between Sialk and the Gilar Oasis.

name: T'ev Basin
description: The T'ev Basin was situated on the Sialk Odhan on Seven Cities.  It was northwest of the city of Sialk and the town of T'ev.

name: T'Kanas Forest
description: The T'kanas Forest was a hardwood forest covering the northwest region of Malaz Island.  To the south it was bordered by the Firstsight Mountains and Karo Bay.  To the east it was bordered by the Flint Plain.  The North and South Malaz Rivers passed through the forest on their way to Malaz City.

name: T'nal
description: T'nal was a town on Seven Cities that was located north of the Karas Sea and the Holy City of Karashimesh.  Vrek was to its south and Hara to its southwest.

name: T'roos
description: T'roos was a nation on the southern coast of the continent of Lether, east of Descent. It was bounded to the north by a mountain range which separated it from Korshenn, Pilott and Isthmus. To the east was Sea Iban.

name: T'sarech
description: T'sarech was a city on the River Ugarat north of the Clatar Sea on Seven Cities.  The river passed through Sarpachiya before reaching T'sarech, then continued on to Nahal.

name: Tahlyn Mountains
description: The Tahlyn Mountains was a range found directly south of Pale, separating the city from Lake Azure. Its jagged peaks could also be seen from Darujhistan which lay on the southern shore of Lake Azur.

name: Talgai Sea
description: Talgai Sea was located to the north of Seven Cities. It was surrounded by Otataral Island on three sides: the west, south, and east. To the north, it joined the Bandiko Sea.

name: Talon Forest
description: Talon Forest was located on the eastern coast of Assail. It abutted an unnamed range of mountains in the northwest. The town of Listell was located on its southern border.

name: Tanys
description: Tanys was a busy port on the eastern coast of the Malyn Sea. It was variously named either a city or a town.

name: Taph
description: Taph was a city in northeastern Genabackis just south of Anklos.  It lay on the coast of the Rust Ocean east of the Sephal Mountains.

name: Taral Plain
description: The Taral Plain covered the south central region of Malaz Island.  It was separated from the South Plain to the east by the Pyre River.  The plain's western boundary was marked by the Rust Hills and the town of Blood.

name: Tarthen Range
description: The Tarthen Range was a chain of mountains in north central Genabackis. It ran from the Owndos Sea (or Lake Blued) in the west to the head of the River Gend in the east.

name: Tarthen River
description: The Tarthen was a river in northwestern Genabackis, one of four which fed into the Owndos Sea.

name: Tarxian
description: Tarxian was a city located on the coast of the Dojal Hading Sea, south of Bylan. It was almost directly due north of Aren.

name: Taxila
description: Taxila was a city in the north of Seven Cities, located on the long Maadil Peninsula between the Kokakal Sea and Maadil Sea just north of the city of Ashok.  To Taxila's north lay the city of Rang.

name: Tela
description: Telaba was a term in the Seven Cities (Bisbrha and Debrahl) language to describe a sea cloak of the Dosii. It was also identified as a traditional outer garment in Seven Cities. The plural for telaba was telaban or telabas. A telaba scarf was mentioned a few times. It is unclear if the scarf was an intrinsic part of a telaba or worn separately. At least some, if not all, telabas had a hood and the cloak was normally worn over other clothing or armour. In one instance, a telaba's overcloak is mentioned. A telaba might also have been worn with a belt.

name: Tellick
description: Tellick was a city on the western coast of Quon Tali.  It was north of the city of Quon Tali and south of Dass.

name: Tenumb
description: Tenumb was a town located north of the Clatar Sea on Seven Cities. It was one of several towns on a river that ran southwards to Geleen and the sea.  To the north were the Jhena Mountains and the Vathar Forest.  To the south was the town of Penalh.

name: Tep
description: The River Tep flowed from the Caron Mountains on Seven Cities to the Dojal Hading Sea. At the river's mouth was the city of Teppes.  Further north was the city of Rathar.

name: Teppes
description: Teppes was a city on the coast of the Dojal Hading Sea on Seven Cities.  It lay at the mouth of the River Tep east of Ubaryd.   The Bakun Road linked the city to Bakun to the southeast. Further up the coast to the northwest was Aallov.

name: Thade
description: Thade was a city in central Quon Tali located between two great rivers which crossed the continent to the Bloor Sea. To its south was Bloor and to its northwest was Rath.

name: Thades
description: Thades was a city in central Quon Tali located between two great rivers which crossed the continent to the Bloor Sea. To its southwest was Rath and to its east was Athrans.

name: Thal (location)
description: Thal was a town in the center of Malaz Island at the western end of the Deland Valley north of the Ricker Mountains.  A road led eastwards to Grain and Monger.  To the west was the T'kanas Forest and a series of tin mines.

name: Thalas Mountains
description: The Thalas Mountains were found on the northern portion of the continent of Seven Cities. To their north were the cities of Hatra and Enjo Estarb and the Maadil Sea, to the northwest was the city of Lothal and the Kokakal Sea, to the south lay the Ugarat Odhan and the city of Y'Ghatan, and to their northeast was the city of Lato Revae.

name: The Bonehunters
description: The Bonehunters is the sixth novel the Malazan Book of the Fallen epic fantasy series. It was first published in the UK and Canada on March 1, 2006 and in the US in September 2007.

name: The Crippled God
description: The Crippled God is the tenth and final volume of Canadian author Steven Erikson's epic fantasy series, the Malazan Book of the Fallen. In an interview, Erikson had mentioned that this book would be the second half of the series finale, with Dust of Dreams ending on a cliffhanger.

name: The Curl
description: The Curl was an inland body of water which separated Protector Isle from the Plains of Blight in the Lands of Fist. It was at the south end of a larger body of water which included the Sender's Sea and the Pirate's Sea.

name: The Divide
description: The Divide was a range of mountains across central Genabackis that ran into the Barghast Range in the east and the Tahlyn Mountains in the west. A trader track passed through a pass in the Divide connecting Pale to Darujhistan, Saltoan, and Capustan. At the time of the war with the Pannion Domin, the Malazan Empire maintained a post in the pass which led smugglers to create an extensive series of trails through the mountains.

name: The Groan
description: The Groan was one of four promontories of land located on the southern tail of Genabackis. It extended into the Galatan Sweep near the city of Refuge and marked the furthest southeastern extent of the continent's mainland. To the northeast was King Call's Isle and to the southwest was Cape Refuge.

name: The Hole
description: The Hole was a lake surrounded by the Ring Wall, and connected to the Flow Strait and the Blight Sea through a narrow strait. The Hole was said to be bottomless and the water was clear enough to see hundreds of feet down.

name: The Horn
description: The Horn was the southwestern-most point of the Quon Tali continent.  It projected from Forest Horn into the Horn Ocean.

name: The Manse
description: The Manse was a Letherii settlement near Fort Shake on the Kingdom of Lether's northern frontier.

name: The Preserve
description: The Preserve was the largest island between the Dracons Sea and the Domain Ocean. It was part of Dracons.[citation needed]

name: The Reach (peninsula)
description: The Reach was the name of a long, narrow peninsula in northwestern Lether, just south of the Calash Sea. The Letherii First Maiden Fort was located near its southwestern tip. Saltsong's Reach was off its southwestern coast. Reach Inlet extended into Lether's interior at the Reach's eastern end.

name: The Reach (Plains)
description: The Reach was the name of a plains area located in the northwest part of the continent of Genabackis. It was bordered by the Menningale Ocean and Moranth Forest to the west, Rhivi Plain to the south, and Blackdog Forest to the north.

name: The Twins
description: The Twins was a location in Genabackis near Callows.  Found on the continental map, it was unclear what type of geographical feature it was.

name: Theft
description: Theft was a region on the northern tip of Korel Island, referred to as both a peninsula and an island though maps indicate it was not an island. The city of Lamentable Moll was located there.

name: Then
description: Then was a city on the western coast of the Nap Sea in Itko Kan.  It lay north of the city of Itko Kan.  Further north on the coast was Buld.

name: Therypand
description: The town of Therypand was located about equidistant between Aren to the south and Tarxian to the north in a hilly/mountainous region on Seven Cities. It was to the east of the village of Balahn.

name: Third Maiden Fort
description: Third Maiden Fort was one of three fortresses in northwestern Lether which defended the mouth of Katter Bight. The other two fortresses were First Maiden Fort and Second Maiden Fort.

name: Thol
description: Thol was a city on the southern shore of the Fist Sea amidst the Trembling Range, in the Kingdom of Rool.

name: Tholemon
description: Tholemon was an ancient tel in Bhilard territory, northwest of the coastal city of Nhelth.

name: Three Maidens Forts
description: The Three Maidens were a string of fortifications in northwestern Lether, one on the mainland and two more on islands which separated the Katter Bight from the Domain Ocean.  They were manned by the Maiden Garrison.

name: Three Roads
description: Three Roads was a town located on the eastern side of Malaz Island.  Its name presumably came from the three roads leading out of town to Grove in the east, Malaz City in the north,  and Pyre in the southwest.

name: Three Sisters
description: Three Sisters was an inland fortress and town on Fist, near the border between the Kingdom of Rool and Skolati. It lay in a valley on the western side of the broad Ancy River along a trading road that passed over a timber and stone bridge built by the Malazan 6th Army.

name: Thyryx
description: The town of Thuryx was located on the coast of Bylah Bay on Seven Cities. Tarxian lay to the northwest and Pult to the southwest.

name: Tiste
description: The races known as the Tiste [tÄ«st] were immigrants to the world of the Malazan Empire who arrived long before the events of the series. They were divided into three major groups, each with its own racial Warren, but all were born of Mother Dark.  They were shown to be frequently at odds during the series.

name: Toblai Tundra
description: The Toblai Tundra was the northwesternmost point of the Genabackis continent.  It extended into the Hudd Sea.

name: Toll the Hounds
description: Toll the Hounds is the eighth novel in the Malazan Book of the Fallen epic fantasy series by Steven Erikson. It was first published in the UK and Canada on June 30, 2008, and in the US on September 16, 2008.

name: Torn (location)
description: Torn was a village on the continent of Genabackis along the coast of the Rivan Sea.  It was to the east of Hurly.

name: Tower of Ruel's Tears
description: The Tower of Ruel's Tears was one of the five primary fortifications of the Stormwall.  It was located on the southwestern half of the wall between Wind Tower and the Great Tower.  The tower was named for Lord Protector Ruel who had thrown himself from its heights after being driven mad by prophetic visions.

name: Tower Sea
description: The Tower Sea was an almost perfectly circular sea surrounded by the Children Ridge Mountains on the east side of Remnant Isle. In the center was a small island on which stood the Sky Tower. It connected with the Flow Strait to the south and the Sender's Sea to the east. Its southeastern shore was bounded by Protector Isle.

name: Towerpoint
description: Towerpoint was a settlement on the southeastern coast of the Black Sea on Assail. It was located a spur of land overlooking where the Black Sea emptied into the Sea of Hate.

name: Trails
description: Trails was a city in the Letherii Empire.  It was located along the northern coast of the Dracons Sea between Deselen and Gress.

name: Traly
description: Traly was a city on the main north-south trader road running through Itko Kan. To the east were Then and Buld, and to the south was Ijor.

name: Trate
description: Trate was a port city in the Kingdom of Lether and the northernmost city of Lether. It was surrounded by walls and protected by trebuchets and ballistae armed with hull-breaching quarrels. A lighthouse overlooked the harbour front.

name: Trelar
description: Trelar was a city in Estobanse Province, Kolanse.

name: Treller Cut
description: The Treller Cut was a narrow channel which connected the inland Malyn Sea, beginning at North Nape, with the Meningalle Ocean at Stick-in-Hole.

name: Truce
description: Truce was one of the nations on the continent of Lether. It bordered on the Dracons Sea.

name: Tulamesh
description: Tulamesh was a town on the western coast of the Letherii Empire facing the Domain Ocean.  To the north was the city of Awl and to the south was the town of Rennis.

name: Tulips
description: Tulips was one of the former Free Cities on the continent of Genabackis.  Conquered by the Malazan Empire, the city was ruled by a Malazan governor.

name: Twill
description: Twill was a city in Pilott, a small nation under the dominion of the Letherii.

name: Ubaryd
description: Ubaryd [OOb-ar-id] was one of the Holy Cities of Seven Cities. It was located on the south coast of the subcontinent on the Dojal Hading Sea.  It was a two month journey by land from Sekal.

name: Ubaryd Odhan
description: The Ubaryd Odhan was found on the east-central portion of the continent of Seven Cities. To its west lay the Ugarat Odhan, to its south was Vathar Forest, to its southeast the Dojal Hading Sea, and to its east the Caron Mountains. The odhan itself was named after the holy city of Ubaryd located on its southern edge.

name: Ugarat
description: Ugarat was one of Seven Cities' holy cities. It was located on the Ugarat Odhan at the center of the continent. The River Ugarat that passed through the city continued on to Sarpachiya and Nahal before reaching the Clatar Sea. The city of Kayhum was upriver to the northeast.

name: Ugarat Odhan
description: The Ugarat Odhan was a desert on the central part of the continent of Seven Cities. It was bordered on the north by the Thalas Mountains, to the south by the Jhena Mountains and Clatar Sea, to the east by the Mersin river, and to the west by the River Ugarat and the Jhag Odhan. The Odhan itself was named after the holy city located on it, Ugarat.

name: Uhlimon
description: Uhlimon was a tel in Seven Cities.

name: Unta
description: Unta was the capital city of the Malazan Empire, located on the north-east coast of the continent of Quon Tali. Once the capital of the Kingdom of Unta, the city had been conquered by the Malazans and its ruling family eradicated.  The city lay on a broad harbour which was overlooked by an ancient pre-Malazan castle.

name: Upper Jakata
description: Upper Jakata was a town in southwestern Malaz Island further up the Lower River Broland from the city of Jakata.

name: Upper Malyn
description: Upper Malyn was a town on the northern shore of Nape Bay in the Malyn Sea in northwestern Genabackis.

name: Urs
description: Urs was a shantytown just outside the southeastern wall of Darujhistan. It lay at the intersection of Hinter Road, which led west to Raven and north to Worrytown, and an unnamed road which led south into the Raven Hills and the Dwelling Plain. Herders and quarry workers passed through the town on their way to work in the Raven Hills.

name: Uthor
description: The city of Uthor was located in the Kundesh Hills near the coast of the Sahul Sea in eastern Seven Cities. The Tapur Road connecting Ahol Tapur and Hissar crossed the hills nearby. A track connected Uthor to Eb in the south.

name: Valan
description: Valan was a city on the western coast of the Quon Tali continent.  It was across the bay from the Quon Tali capital city of the same name.

name: Valley of Blessed Gift
description: Blessed Gift, or the Valley of Blessed Gift, was the old name of a plain on Kolanse south of Kolanse City.  It had once been rich with wheat.

name: Vanishing Wastes
description: The Vanishing Wastes on Assail were bounded by the Dread Sea to the east, the Blood Range to the northeast, and the Range of the Saints to the west. The plain was also known as the Vanishing Lands and the Lands of Dust, and it was said that any who ventured onto the plains were never seen again.

name: Vathar
description: The river Vathar marked the northern edge of the Vathar Forest and emptied into the Dojal Hading Sea on the Seven Cities continent.

name: Vathar Forest
description: Vathar Forest was located on the central portion of the continent of Seven Cities and bordered to the north by the river of the same name. To its east was the Holy City of Ubaryd, to its north was the Ubaryd Odhan, to its northwest were the Ugarat Odhan and the Jhena Mountains, while to its southeast was the Dojal Hading Sea.

name: Venj
description: Venj was a town on the coast of the Sahul Sea on Seven Cities.  An unnamed river flowing out of the Caron Mountains near the Bakutalar Forest crossed the plain to reach the town.

name: Vin'til Basin
description: The Vin'til Basin was situated southwest of Hissar.  To the northeast was the Nuth Basin.

name: Vision Mountains
description: The Vision Mountains marked the northern border of the Pannion Domin occupied lands. They were located southwest of Capustan.

name: Vor
description: Vor was a city on the southern coast of Quon Tali on the eastern side of the Nap Sea. To its west was Marl and to its east was Carasin.

name: Voron
description: Voron was a city in northeastern Quon Tali located on the coast of the Colonnus Sea.

name: Vrek
description: Vrek was a town on Seven Cities that was located north of the Karas Sea and the Holy City of Karashimesh.  It was south of T'nal and east of Hara.

name: Wal Fend
description: Wal Fend was a city in Itko Kan on the coast of the Horn Ocean.  It lay east of Bathi and south of Wal Tes.

name: Wal Tes
description: Wal Tes was a city in Itko Kan on the western coast of the Nap Sea.  To the south was Wal Fend. To the northwest was Largen.

name: Walk
description: Walk was a city in Falar located on one of the larger Falari Isles on the shores of the Walk Sea.

name: Walk Sea
description: The Walk Sea was located in the interior of the Falari Isles, north of the Strom Sea. On its shores was the city of Walk.

name: Water Reach Wood
description: Water Reach Wood was located in northwestern Genabackis, south of Hole Hills and north of Sidewind Hills.

name: Weeping Plains
description: The Weeping Plains were located on the Bael subcontinent. They were the location of the Spur, the fortress home of the warlock, Shen.

name: Wend
description: Wend was a city on the southern coast of the Bluerose Sea on Lether.  To the west was Stall and to the east was Olived.

name: West Fort
description: West Fort was located in southwest Dourkan, on the border with the Empire of Jourilan.

name: West Malyn Range
description: The West Malyn Range was part of a chain of mountains running east-west in northwestern  Genabackis.  Beginning on the coast of the Menningale Ocean, they ran east to join the Central Malyn Range.  To the north was Redstick Forest and the Toblai Tundra.  To the south was Genabaris and the Malyn Sea.

name: West River
description: The West River was located in western Malaz Island.  It originated near the tin mines on the southern slopes of the Firstsight Mountains and joined the River Broland at Broland Meet.

name: White
description: White was a city in western Quon Tali near Lake Seti.  It was northeast of the city of Quon Tali, west of High Postern, and east of Tellick.

name: White Butte Hills
description: The White Butte Hills lined the southern end of Malaz Bay on Malaz Island.

name: White Cliffs
description: The White Cliffs ran along Bael's eastern coast from the Anari Narrows to the vicinity of Towerpoint.

name: White Mountains
description: The White Mountains ran along the northeast coast of Malaz Island, known as the Chisel Coast.  To the south was the Flint Plain.

name: White Point
description: White Point was a Letherii town in northwestern Lether on the eastern shore of the East Shake River. Brans Keep and Five Points were located to its southwest.

name: White Spires Ocean
description: The Explorer's Sea, (or the White Spires Ocean or the White Spires Sea), was the southernmost ocean in the world of the Malazan Book of the Fallen.  White Spires derived from the islands of floating ice that threatened mariners.

name: White Spires Sea
description: The Explorer's Sea, (or the White Spires Ocean or the White Spires Sea), was the southernmost ocean in the world of the Malazan Book of the Fallen.  White Spires derived from the islands of floating ice that threatened mariners.

name: Wickan Plains
description: The Wickan Plains were located in the northeastern part of Quon Tali and were the home of the Wickan people. The plains were bordered to the west by the by Colonnus Sea and to the east by the Falari Sea. The closest city was Baran, to the south.

name: Widden
description: Widden was a town on the eastern coast of Assail and the Sea of Hate. It was located to the north of Talon Forest and to the east of Pillar.

name: Wolt
description: Wolt was a town on the western coast of Dourkan, on the Crack Strait.

name: Worrytown
description: Worrytown was a slum, consisting of a handful of sagging buildings, outside the eastern side of the city walls of Darujhistan. It sprawled on either side of the East Gate and along Jatem's Worry (Jammit's Worry).

name: Wrack Coast
description: The Wrack Coast was Assail's northeastern shore with the Sea of Hate. It marked the northernmost extent of the Plain of Sighs.

name: Wreck Isle
description: Wreck Isle was one of the larger Night Ship Islands located at the tip of southern Genabackis' tail.  Nearby was Corpse Isle.

name: Wreckers' Coast
description: The Wreckers' Coast (also spelled Wrecker's Coast occasionally) was located on the eastern coast of Assail. It was essentially the southeastern shore of the Bay of Timber, which was a body of water extending westward from the Sea of Hate. The deadly Fear Narrows opened out from Wreckers' Coast, leading into the Dread Sea. Bones, Pillar and Widden were coastal towns which were situated along Wreckers' Coast and were, presumably, full of wreckers as this stretch of coastline was one of the best known and most notoriously dangerous of the world's so-called "wreckers' coasts" - being, for example, avoided for this reason by Malazan shipping.

name: Xixr
description: Xixr was a city located west of the Blood Isthmus in Katakan. To the south was the city of Bali.

name: Y'Ghatan
description: Y'Ghatan [yeah-gah-tan]was a city in the north of the Seven Cities sub-continent, and was the birthplace of both the First Empire and the Apocalypse. Also known as the City of the Olive Groves and the city of the sweet oils, it was known for its production and vast stores of olive oil. Its people were known as Y'Ghanii.

name: Yath Alban
description: Yath Alban was one of Seven Cities holy cities. It was found on the coast of the Kokakal Sea near the Olphara Mountains on the northwest section of the continent.

name: Yellow Mark Forest
description: The Yellow Mark Forest was located in northwestern Genabackis south of the Lesser Laederon Plateau and the city of Malybridge. Both the East Fool's and West Fool's Rivers flowed through the forest before joining to form the Fool's River south of Marktown.

name: Yellows
description: Yellows was a city on the southeastern coast of Quon Tali facing the Bloor Sea. To its southwest was Gast and to its north was Larent.

name: Yend
description: Yend was a city on Genabackis close to the One Eye Range. It was located just west of One Eye Cat and southeast of Bodd.

name: Zelt
description: Zelt was a city in eastern Jasston in the Lands of Fist. It was located on the coast of The Curl near the border of the Plains of Blight.

name: Zestr
description: Zestr was an eastern city on the southern coast of the Kingdom of Rool, on the Black Water Strait.
